choices: Follow the brash Mightyena Moemon - Midnight skipping her first class
Follow the young Quilava Moemon - Ali whose late to orientation
Follow the curvy Vaporeon Moemon - Fontina who has the first class off
Don Tanner: "Let's look at the other girls who attend classes here..."
Don Tanner: "Might as well look at the guys who attend... Bleh..."
1.content:
Don Tanner sighed loudly as he spun around in his seat, a large smile on his face as he looked around the very fancy office that he sat in. Amongst the walls were several tapestries that depicted several dragon pokemon on them. With his legs lifted up, Don Tanner slammed his fee onto the desk he was seated behind, “Man, dad, you certainly had a comfy job.”

Leaning back, the Dragonair Moemon smirked as he lifted up a small map in front of him – On the map was what appeared to be an island that had several buildings on it – A large main building with a track and several sport fields around it. A few miles from that, there was a pair of buildings that were marked on the map as ‘Dorms’. There were also several other facilities on the island, but before Don Tanner could read them all, he immediately tossed the map to the side, “Alright, I may have inherited the principal position from my father here at St. Gijinka Academy, but its not like this is a cushy job… Still beats hanging around that dusty old mansion of course.”

With a quick gaze to the desk, Don Tanner sighed at the sight of the tall mountain of papers that sat on it. “Although, I do wish I didn’t have to deal with all these student files. But then again as dad said…

“As principal of this fine school, a principal must know all of his students who are under him.

“Man dad, you had some harsh life rules.”

With a sigh, Don Tanner lifted up one of the papers up and began to read the profiles on his students and… Teachers?

Student No. 1

Name: Midnight
Gender: Female
Moemon: Mightyena
Age: 18
Class: Junior
Description: A dark haired beauty of a woman with a dynamite, tan body with curves in all the right places (although she thinks she can do better with her figure), usually dresses in a black leather jacket, cut off jean shorts and a silver belly shirt, pushing the academy dress code.
Personality: The so-called leader of this party, she’s quite prideful and has an overbearing ego. She has a quick temper when it comes to dealing with one of her other teammates (but has a secret affinity to sweets).
Extra: Loves chocolate (but doesn’t like to broadcast that fact), was also held back two years for playing hooky.

Student No. 2

Name: Alison (Nickname Ali)
Gender: Female
Moemon: Quilava
Age: 16
Class: Freshman
Description: A small, petite girl (so much that she often gets confused that she’s a little girl) with short red and black hair with a cute face. Over her petite body is a yellow and black hoodie and a red skirt.
Personality: A hot headed girl who often bumps heads with Midnight over random crap. She often falls prey to cute guys and whatever tricks they have up their sleeves. Has a vulgar tongue to her.
Extra: She’s really envious of other girls’ figures that are better than hers, and seems to have a crush on the local Riolu delinquent leader.

Student No. 3

Name: Fontina
Gender: Female
Moemon: Vaporeon
Age: 18
Class: Senior
Description: A shy cute girl with short blue hair (with a few fin-like bangs) who dresses in a white blouse and a long blue skirt. She has the best figure out of the three girls on this team, and is often shy about people talking about her curvy figure.
Personality: A voice of reason in this School, although, she often has her words of wisdom ignored most people until she actually makes her point. Loves to read and often gets too deep in her books to realize what’s happening around her.
Extra: She used to be a petite Eevee Moemon in her freshman year, but thanks to the school’s cafeteria food and her studying habits, she developed her figure (and it grew worse when she turned into a Vaporeon Moemon). She’s currently on a diet. President of the book club and Librarian.

Don Tanner pulled the papers away with a raised eyebrow, “These profiles… They read like some bad Fanfiction writer wrote them… They sound like the personal ads. I suppose I should look at the other profiles as well..."
1.title: Enrolling into the School

choices: Saw that Fontina was still there... Time for a late breakfast!
Fontina was gone? Head to the library to find the curvy Vaporeon
No one's here... Hmm... Maybe I should see if anyone else is here...
reader's choice
Reader's choice
11.content:
Darkness.

That’s all she could see…

“Aliiiiii…”

Twitch.

“Hmmm… Oh gosh, I told her not to stay up so late.”

Twitch. Twitch.

“Aliii… Come on, wake up. Omigosh, do you think she's... no, she couldn't be! Oh no, she’s dead!”

Twitch. Twitch. Twitch.

Then only whispers could echo through the dark, allowing the sleeping form to slowly doze back into her sleep… At least until…

“HOLY CRAP! NINE IN THE FREAKING MORNING!?!”

Now that was the last straw that broke the Camerupt’s back, and opening her yellow eyes, the sleeping form immediately lifted her head up from her pillow. And while she was annoyed with the fact that her sleep was broken, she couldn’t help but smirk at the sight of the young Quilava Moemon roommate dashing around, trying to get ready while tripping over herself, all the while the busty Vaporeon Moemon was trying to calm down the younger girl.

‘Nothing like a fun little show to wake up to in the morning.’

“Again, I’m really sorry for not waking you up sooner.”

“It’s cool! But if you ever let me sleep in that late again, I’ll pop your bubble boobies with a fork.”

And with that, the door to the dorm room closed shut, allowing the Vaporeon Moemon sigh slightly. “I can remember when I was a freshman… I always thought I’d be late…”

“You also used to be able to see your feet too, Fontina.”

The curvy Vaporeon Moemon – Fontina turned around towards one of the beds to see that her third and final roommate was finally awake… “G-Good morning to you as well, Midnight.”

The girl in question merely sat atop of her bed’s covers, stretching her arms over head, in an attempt to showcase her curves – She may not have been as curvaceous as Fontina was, but she was no slouch with her perky breasts and toned behind. They were easily seen since she was dressed in only a black wife beater that was two sizes too small for her slightly hourglass figure and a pair of black panties. Her long black hair was a little messy due to the fact that she had just woken up and had a little case of bed-head, but the strands were kept out of her beautiful face.

As Midnight slowly pushed herself from the bed, the mocha skinned beauty stood in front of Fontina, secretly making a comparison between herself and the Vaporeon Moemon. “Yeah, yeah… So, the little runt’s late for her first class huh?”

“I… I believe it was b-b-because you kept egging her on to play those vi-video games last night,” Fontina countered as she pushed up her glasses.

“Hey, you wanted me to be friendly to her,” Midnight replied as she slowly walked over to the bathroom. “Not my fault she’s a sore loser.”

“You know that you’re late too,” Fontina answered back, sighing as she rubbed her slightly softened stomach. “And here I was hoping that we all could get breakfast early today…”

“Oh come on,” Midnight retorted as she grabbed her usually toiletries – Some (somewhat) clean clothes, a towel, and her favorite shampoo. “Ya know I don’t like eating breakfast, Fontina.”

“Yeah, but I’m sure my sister would’ve made some other food for you,” Fontina pointed out, grimacing as she rubbed her stomach.

“Oh yeah, you said your big sis was working here now,” Midnight mumbled slightly as she headed for the door. “Oh well, maybe you and I could get something after I take a quick shower.”

“But don’t you have classes?” Fontina questioned.

“Skipping a class never hurt anyone,” Midnight replied as she closed the door to the bathroom.

Immediately closing the door to the bathroom, Midnight was unable to hear Fontina mumble, “But skipping is what got you held back…”

TTTTTTTTTT


It didn’t take long for Midnight to peal off the panties and top she was using as pajamas, and she hopped into the shower, immediately allowing the warm water to wash over her chocolate colored body and pitch-black hair. “Ahh… A show and a shower, the perfect opening for the day.”

Taking the body wash that Fontina left in the shower, Midnight rubbed the sweet smelling hygiene product over her body. In order to keep up her beautiful, yet tough image, she had to smell good… And smelling like cherry blossoms seemed to work. However as Midnight’s hands rubbed onto her normally well toned stomach, she stopped and realized something…

She could pinch some of herself. ‘Great… I gotta lay off those late night chocolate binges…’

Putting it out of her mind, Midnight continued her warm (if not seductive) shower.

It was only a few minutes later that Midnight opened the door to the bathroom – Now dressed in her usual attire of a silver belly shirt that showed off a decent amount of cleavage and midriff, a black leather jacket (that had seen better days) and a pair of jean shorts that showed off her toned, trim legs. As she looked around the room, Midnight…
11.title: The Mocha Skinned Beauty - Midnight

choices: Nah, she's got better stuff to do. She'll hit this up later.
What else is there to do? Midnight stays here and mooches off this lummox
Ugh, readers choice...
114.content:
...saw absolutely nothing to do of even the slightest remote interest to occupy herself with.

"Ugh." she groaned; now that she was up and about in clean clothing, there really wasn't a reason not to go to class- or at least get out of the dorm. She'd been going here for a full four years now (running on her fifth), in that time period Midnight had done absolutely everything a Bad Girl could possibly want to do in a hoity-toity academy such as the one she currently attended. Her teachers recommended that she study and keep her mind at work, when they weren't threatening her with expulsion, and some classmates suggested getting a hobby. But those things weren't really for Midnight. She had never studied once a day in her life, and she was always way too cool for making stupid... model airplanes or whatever hobbies were.

No; back in Hoenn, where she and her parents used to live before moving to Johto, she studied the wild unpredictable forests, her hobby was intimidating all the other kids on the block. At age 8, she had beat up this Zigzagoon kid, and when she got her older brother he just whooped his butt too! After the move, Midnight noticeably calmed down; no longer a simple Wild Girl, Midnight's divulging into Johto's cozy mix of metropolitan and oriental culture had exposed her to the finer things in life. While she didn't really care for much of them, it at least gave her some class and structure. Instead of modelling herself after the brutal Magma tribes in Hoenn's past, the then young Poocheyena moemon came to emulate the rougher city girls that she had been exposed to in her habitation in Goldenrod. Of course, this was where she would meet Fontina and later Ali; but that's a story for another time.

For now, Midnight was stuck with the simple options of either: run the course of the campus (again), or actually show up to her second period. She checked the wall clock. Damn, it was already 9:35! She really had to stop taking such long showers! "Weeellll, since I'm already late," the Mighteyena moemon said slyly as a toothy grin spread itself across her sharp features, "And I'm really not into breakfast..." she said deviously aloud to herself as she started for the doorway, "I guess I'll just have to pop on by the campus!"

With that Midnight whipped the door open and allowed the bright sunny air to pour itself onto her face.

St. Gijinka Academy. It was, even the socially undercultured Midnight had to agree, beautiful. From their high dorm in Building D, anyone on the 12th floor could see rows of eleven windows shooting downwards towards the tan pueblos of St. Gijinka. As Midnight gripped onto the safety railing that guarded most moemon from a damningly doomed fall, she picked one foot up and rested it on the thick black metal. Holding onto the vertical pole that supported it, she used the fence as support to pick up her other leg so that she may stand bravely at the face of the educational abyss.

She took a deep inhale, and relaxed.

Using the sort of strength that only Hoenn girls could even hope to have, Midnight kicked off with a mighty strut of her misguidingly underplayed legs. For a full three seconds, Midnight is airborne before landing on a balcony four stories lower on Building E. She grips onto the pole and eases slowly down before reaching a distance safe enough to fall onto the much smaller Building A, which stands base to Building E. She lands on her feet, catching herself with the tips of her fingers, and lets out a grunt. "Oh man, that was rough." she said with mild agitation, several popping sounds heard as her knees ached. "I gotta remember to dig up those Yoga tapes so I don't break something one day." she said to herself before getting a running start into another Hail-Mary jump.

This time she landed on an awning, more specifically the one belonging to the Bad Luck Shop. "Huh, its a Unovian restaurant now." Midnight said with mild amusement, "Last month it was a bookstore." As much as she was "not into breakfast", a low rumble escaped Midnight's tummy. "What's that tummy?" she asked playfully, "You're hungry?"

She rolled her eyes before scanning the visible horizon, "Well... I don't really see anything. At least anything that doesn't taste like crap." she spat unto the marketplace. For the last couple of years, in addition to her lackluster attendance record, Midnight had really become a restaurant aficionado when it came to the little Mom 'n' Pop stores around the academy. Not even the Sheer Cold Creamery, a place that had led to a few pounds and inches during her freshman year, could really satisfy her hunger anymore. It was all too familiar, too simple. Even the Bad Luck Shop's constantly changing motif did little to satisfy her. Even if it was good, the business would just fail in a month or two anyway.

Another low rumble. "Oh quiet you." Midnight barked as she looked peevishly into the city, "Now there's got to be something out here to do besides... ugh, school."

Starting from her position on top of the Bad Luck Shop, Midnight hopped up onto the main building and climbed onto the neighboring florist. Turning left, she jumped atop the comic book shop and turning back to her right from there landed her atop the Bellsprout Boudoir. From an elevated position, Midnight could make out La tienda de la Casa del Agua , a nice little place run by a Ludicolo Moemon and his wife. But that was really more for groceries. There were little novelty stands, but Midnight had lived here too long to be amused by those little tourist gags. Fruit Stands? Ew. Cliched.

Hey, hey! There, off in the distance, was something new and shiny! Jumping from there, Midnight landed on a clothesline, caught herself with the tips of her fingers, and let herself go abruptly onto the street. "Hey!" she shouted at the bulky Vigoroth moemon handling said novel attraction, "What'cha got there?" An innocent question enough, but almost everything sounded flirty with Midnight. It couldn't be helped. "Oh, well my boys and I got these here vending machines from the Boss." he said, sounding rather proud of his overall lifting ability, "Mr. Sunny told me to get 'em down here in the busy streets where people could see 'em, lifted this one here all by myself."

"Does it work?"

The Vigoroth moemon held up an index finger, bent down, and connected the wire from the machine to the one out of Portabello Parasect Pizza Parlor, and emerged. Immediately, the machine came to life with lights and colors. Midnight's mouth started to water as her tummy began to growl. "I take it that it works now?"

"Well, I gotta load up the stuff inside, but gimme about thirty minutes an' I'll have this puppy up an' running."
114.title: Feats of Athleticism

choices: Vayne drags Midnight on the golf-cart and brings her to another vending machine
Midnight gives up and heads to one of the nearby shops (Vayne follows)
Again, reader's choice
1143.content:
Midnight was a little interested in these new treats that this vending machine had to offer – and by interested, at the very sight of the treats that were slowly being unloaded by the Vigoroth Moemon. Needless to say, what the Mightyena saw wasn’t the cheapest of foods, the kind that you’d expect to see in a vending machine.

Swinub Sweets’ Chocolate creamed and iced donuts, half gallon bottles of Krooko-aid (in its many flavors), Vileplume Farms’ fresh fruit, there was even Beartic Ice Cream bars (those were being put in first). Most of these brand names were known to be extremely expensive, and yet here they were, being put in a vending machine by this husky Vigoroth. If the school was putting them in a vending machine, then the prices were sure to be not so outrageous…

*gggrrgle*

With her hand placed on her toned (if not empty) stomach, Midnight scrunched her face up in annoyance, as she had told herself before, she was not a breakfast person.

Now, a snack person… Especially when there were chocolate filled, chocolate covered, chocolate chipped, or any thing that was mixed in with chocolate… Now that was another story. So a small plan began to form itself inside Midnight’s devious mind.

“So, how long have you been working on this sort of stuff?” Midnight asked as she sauntered a little closer towards the Vigoroth, making sure to sway her jean short covered hips just a little more than usual.

This didn’t go unnoticed by the Vigoroth as he almost stumbled in putting in a few of the donuts into the machine. “O-Oh, not too long miss, we were commissioned to do this early this morning and get it done while the freshmen were at their orientation and the other students were in their first class… Speaking of, aren’t you supposed to be in one of those classes?”

“Aw, don’t you worry about little young me,” Midnight cooed as she ran a finger on one of the boxes. “You don’t like having to talk to a fine young girl like me, now don’cha?”

The face of the larger Moemon was now a bright cherry red, and yet he just continued on his work, trying to get his mind off of the flirty attempts by this mocha skinned vixen. “W-Well… I have to get this done r-real soon.”

“Hmm, too bad,” Midnight pouted with large puppy dog eyes as she leaned forward, trying to show a healthier dose of cleavage to the older Moemon. “I had so hoped to talk to such a strong, strapping Vigoroth… Oh well, can I at least ask for one little, teeny, tiny favor?”

“Uh, s-sure,” The Vigoroth gulped, and his brow began to get covered with sweat especially when Midnight began to trot her fingers over his large bicep. “W-What is it?”

“Might if I have just a small sample of these fine wares?” Midnight asked innocently enough, getting closer and closer towards the Vigoroth’s body. “I mean, a guy as sweet as you could spare a couple of chocolate donuts… Right?”

“Uh, w-well,” The Vigoroth stammered as his eyes began to roll into the back of his head, the excitement starting to overtake his nervous system. “I… I…”

“Hmm? What sort of evil deeds are going on here?” A rather gruff and heroic voice sounded through the air.

Both Midnight and Vigoroth turned to where the voice originated and they were both struck dumb at the sight before them. For in front of them was a familiar red golf-cart (that had Mr. Sunny written on the side of it), but what drew their eyes was the figure that stood atop of the golf cart.

Dressed in a messy red and black baseball jersey, black pants and a red shirt stood tall a muscular Arcanine with his wild blonde hair billowing past his broad shoulders. If it was for the fact that he had a large goofy grin on his scarred face, his dramatic pose would’ve given him the appearance of a dashing young hero.

‘Damn it, its Vayne,’ Midnight sighed as she slowly inched away from an awestruck Vigoroth.

The Arcanine known as Vayne leapt from the golf-cart and landed effortlessly on the ground before the other two Moemon, his arms crossed over his chest. “Ah, if it isn’t madame Midnight! Up to your lustful tricks this morning again?”

“Madame?!” Midnight snarled as she leered daggers at the oblivious Arcanine Moemon. “Do I look like an old lady?!”

“To me you are almost as such,” Vayne chuckled with a shake of his head. “But it is my way of showing respect.”

“Yeah, well it sucks,” Midnight growled in return. “Now what do you want?”

The Vigoroth Moemon blinked a few times at the two canine moemons’ little squabble and slowly began to get back to work.
1143.title: A chance for a free sample... Damn, its the hero..

choices: Vayne pulls up at a machine, where Midnight's only limitation is her thin wallet
They arrive at another machine, already in use by yet another delinquent...
11431.content:
"As this academy's protector," Vayne began, with his usual fervor in long drawn-out speeches about morality and whatnot, as he started towards the slinking evil that was his nemesis, "The joyful burden of guarding my precious Alma Mater from the wicked deeds of seductive harlots and the rest of your ilk is rested solely upon my shoulders and mine alone." he said in a dramatized, deep rendition of his usual voice. "For my heart burns with the fiery passion of a protectors, one that melts the evil away from those that I care for and scorches only the deserving; I am-"

"Look, just freaking enough, okay?!"

Midnight, while passionate and protective in her own rights, was far from patient and understanding. This, on top of being painted on the darker side of things and her leaning towards manipulation, was what actually led to the dispute in question in the first place. Sure, when one looked abstractly, the two would make a great pair: both had great physical strength and almost completely forewent their individual elemental prowess, both were loud and older than most students. But, when it came down to it, Vayne was just so damn annoying that anything that came out of his mouth seemed to grate on a certain Mightyena moemon's nerves. "You've been playing Superhero since Freshman year, Vayne!" Midnight shouted wildly, "Can it with the whole "protector" crap and get a life! Maybe a girlfriend or something, seriously, pick up a hobby!" Of course, she failed to recognize the hypocrisy in her arbitration; as she'd been playing "bad girl" for quite some time too...

"Enough, wench!" Vayne exclaimed, still posing in a way that deserved a thick outline and a cape even as he defended his standpoint, "I will not stand by and let you make a mockery out of the Academy's simple stockmen!" the Arcanine Avenger declared as he rushed Midnight. His wide bulk, as proven several times, kept a good bit of his opponent's immediate escape room occupied. However, again like so many times before, Midnight's agile reflexes and strong leg muscles provided her with more than enough physical strength to propel herself above the would-be hero via frontflip; putting her in front of the vending machine and behind the pituitary case of a Vigoroth, who seemed to be simply ignoring the scuffle at hand and right back at work peacefully. "You're getting stale, Slugger!" Midnight taunted as she turned around, "Or maybe you're just losing interest."

Vayne fumed, his long platinum hair waving cautious flows towards Midnight as the Legendary Moemon activated his signature move: "Extremespeed!" he shouted, instantly vanishing in a flashstep so fast that you could not blink and miss it. Midnight looked around for any sign of distortion, anything that might give away his current plan of attack. To the left; nothing. The right? Nothing. Even the ever-predictable above tactic didn't seem to be useful...

Oh wait.

The feeling of anticipation led Midnight to guard her ankles! She did another flip from her standing position, feeling quite cocky in her abilities to defend herself from anklebiting scum like Vayne... when she felt an intense burst of air knock her face-first into the ground. Aerial strike, well played. And, with the added pressure of Vayne's muscley build on top of her, Midnight was all but bested. "Huh." she rasped, "Nice one, Hero."

***

"So this whole thing was about me not paying for my snacks?!" Midnight barked as she sat hogtied in Vayne's Golf Mobile, hopping up and down furiously as Vayne's heroic smile gleamed stereotypically in the sunlight. "Absolutely." he said deeply as he continued to steer his golf cart down the streets of the city surrounding his academy, "So long as you start paying for your snack foods and other yummies, there will be no hard feelings between us on this matter!"

...

"So why hogtie me?"

"So that I may bring you to another, untainted snack treat vendor without fear of retribution." he said happily, "I shall untie you when we arrive at a suitable location."

"Where I will promptly punch you in the face."
11431.title: Merciless Mightyena and the Arcanine Avenger!

choices: Midnight just leaves... And helps herself to the wrecked Vending Machine
Following the Arcanine Avenger... It'll be funny at the very least.
114312.content:
It didn’t take long for Vayne’s (stolen) golf cart to slow to a stop, shaking the hogtied Midnight in her seat. Heck, the next working vending machine was practically around the corner (which was both convenient and somewhat weird). The virtuous Arcanine laughed loudly as he stepped from the cart’s driver seat and proceeded to head over to Midnight so he could untie her. “And here we are!”

“… You had to tie me up just to take me here?!” Midnight growled with a blood vessel appearing on the side of her head. Midnight easily recognized this place, it was practically right next to her favorite clothing store that had her favorite, cheap black leathered jackets. They were parked a few feet from the corner, but the machine was still in sight as it leaned up against the building. “We could’ve walked!”

“And would you have walked if I told you?” Vayne countered as he slowly began to undo the knots of the rope he had wrapped around the mocha skinned Mightyena. However, as he continued to untie, the Arcanine Avenger didn’t show any hesitation from Midnight’s earlier threat to pop him one in the kisser. “I don’t think so. Besides, I couldn’t help but stop evil in its place and…”

KER-RAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAASSSSSSSSH

Vayne’s and Midnight’s ears perked up when the sound of glass shattering, and it was rather close by too boot. Vayne turned his head to the side and looked at the vending machine to see that there was a large amount of glass and a brick laying before the machine. “Fiends! Not even the first day has passed and already two evildoers are trying to ruin the brand new machines on our island!

“This is unacceptable!”

“H-Hey!” Midnight barked as she wiggled about, partially to get free from her binds and the rest to get Vayne’s attention. “You stupid mutt! Get your mind off of your damn justice for thirty seconds and untie me!”

Thirty seconds later…

Midnight grumbled as she rubbed the skin where the ropes had caused some minor friction burns, Vayne however was tossing the rope into the back of the golf cart and crossed his arms. “There, now can I please continue on the path of justice?”

“Just one more thing…” Midnight stated as she stomped up to the Arcanine…

WHAM!

Midnight’s fist collided with Vayne’s right cheek, making the young hero turn his head upon impact… But other than that, there seemed to be no damage to the Arcanine’s face! In fact, while it took a few seconds, but then Midnight’s eyes grew wide and she pulled her fist back. Her fist was red and was burning with pain, “SONVABITCH! What the hell is your face made of?!?!”

“I’ve taken worse hits right here,” Vayne answered as he patted his freshly punched face, although, there wasn’t a bruise or even a red patch on his face. “It’s a technique that martial artists used on their arms by bashing rocks on their arms and sides of their arms. It’s to build up calcium deposits in a person’s skin, so it becomes as hard as rock!

“And since I’ve been hit there so many times, I’ve developed a large amount of calcium in my face…”

“So, you’re a literal rock head?!” Midnight hissed loudly as she waved her hand a few times trying to shake away the pain. “Yeesh! You keep getting weirder!”

“That’s enough, my sassy sidekick!” Vayne laughed chuckled as he began to head towards the vending machine. “There’s evil afoot!”

“Who the hell told you I was your sidekick!!?!” Midnight practically roared as she chased after Vayne.

Although, the two didn’t have to go too far to see the damage that was done to the vending machine, and it wasn’t that hard to figure out what had happened. Someone threw a brick at the glassed vending machine, and had made off with quite a number of snacks and drinks from inside it.

Vayne surveyed the scene with his hand at his chin, “Hmm, this machine… Was murdered!”

“What the?!” Midnight scowled. “Of all the stupidest things to say…”

“Well, in a sense it was murdered,” Vayne stated with a shrug of his shoulders. “It was struck in the face with a brick and had its…”

“Just forget it,” Midnight growled with her tongue sticking out. “I’m getting tired of dealing with your crap! Every moment that I’ve had to deal with you, everything’s gone south and…”

That’s when a finger was placed on Midnight’s lips, courtesy of Vayne. With his other hand, the Arcanine pointed a few yards away towards a table that was partially hidden from view from a few of the nearby shrubs and trees. Seated at the table (which was loaded with the brim with snacks and drinks that were obviously from the vending machine) sat a particularly weird looking Moemon. The Moemon in question was dressed in a tan-yellow hooded jacket with a lined black shirt that was ripped at the neck and over the stomach. The most eyecatching about this Moemon was the fact that her head only had red hair on one half of her head, and that hair was combed down on the right side of her face.

This punk-like Moemon was currently munching on some of the pilfered food…

Which Vayne quickly smirked at, “Ah, evildoers certainly are lazy now-a-days… Come Merciless Mightyena! We must stop evil!”

“… Who the hell came up with that name?” Midnight growled as she watched Vayne dash forward. Now, part of her wanted to walk away and let Vayne make a hero (ass) out of himself, but another part wanted to watch how this turns out… And heck, maybe she could sneak a few snacks away from that thief that Vayne would obviously distract…

Choices, choices… So many choices.
114312.title: One ‘Wanna-Be’ Hero, Two Delinquents

choices: Freakin yes! Midnight is all about sugar over here!
Frea- wait a sec... is that a layer of pudge on Eldreich? That's hilarious!!
1143122.content:
In the form of a deep sigh, her choice was made clear. While it would have been oodles of fun to just sit back and let what is be, Midnight just simply couldn't stand back and let a freak like Vayne endanger the sanity of yet another honest student here at the academy... even if it was Eldreich.

The two of them never really got along well, from the very start Eldreich thought herself the superior tough chick of the academy due to her schoolyard days filled with brawls with the toughest Unovian students at her disposal. Most of them, admittedly, were pretty scary individuals. Having grown up and attended school on Unova Route 4, located in a harsh desert, she was subject to the company of the Sandile evolutionary chain. She would eventually learn how to fight and proceed to whoop every one of their butts up until Grade 8. Of course, the only reason Midnight knew this was due to the fact that Eldreich never freakin' shut up about herself. Always so egotistical and arrogant in her abilities... it probably reminded her a little too much of herself, actually. Anyway she decided that, for once, she would be the bigger moemon and step inbetween her sworn rival and just another annoyance. Whichever of the two fits to what category we'll leave up to third-party decision.

Of course that didn't mean that she'd back off and deny Vayne his entertainment. Or hers. Watching Vayne preach about morality and whatnot was so hilarious it was almost cute. He had morals. Ha, that's gut-busting. Anyway, Vayne decided to take her vague sighing as a green light that she would be coming with; his ambush on slithering, crafty Eldreich would be all the more fulfilling now that one of her ilk had turned against her! "Come Merciless, we have justice to spread!" he shouted loudly, much to said sidekick's dismay. "Yeah, sure, whatever. " she said boredly, crossing her arms and plodding slowly forward, "Just make with the super-hero jazz so I can hurry up and grab a bite. I'm starved."

Vayne's toothy smile did little to encourage her. "No worries, this delinquent is simply on the wrong side of justice." he said valiantly, "Why, if even you can be converted to the cause, then what's to say that she can't also?" Midnight ignored the urge to drop kick that smarmy grin off of his face, fighting it as she had him just a few minutes ago. "Whatever." she said indignantly. "Quite whatever indeed!" Vayne repeated vigorously as he made a dash for the still obliviously dining Eldreich. "Hey, wait up!" Midnight hollered after him, "I don't wanna miss this!" But of course the thick-headed moemon was too far gone in his drive for justice to really take into account anything that Midnight was saying. The petty justice that needed serving was afoot, about slathered all over Eldreich and her illegally gotten goods.

Stopping in front of the table, Vayne pointed strongly in the direction of the Scrafty moemon's post-breakfast pilfer. "You, vile woman, are in desperate need of some discipline!" he said heartily, "Now stand so that I may deliver said discipline without the guilt of striking an unready opponent."

Of all the "bad kids" that took residence in St. Gijinka's, Eldreich was one of the many who refused to play along with Vayne's superhero style of life. Sure there were a few who loved to humor him, namely Midnight, but the majority just wished that he would lay off of their faces and let them be. Of course he wouldn't. That was a lesson that most of them learned the hard way. "Go away Kibbles." Eldreich said through a mouthful of masticated doughnut mush, "I'm eating." Vayne, slightly taken aback by her utter refusal to play along, simply reiterated his presence. "I-I see that!" he wavered, "And your consumption of those illgotten goods is precisely why I-

"Look, I'm not gonna get up." Eldreich said boredly, swallowing her mouthful before taking another big bite, "So just get about your way and leave a girl alone."

Vayne had actually never encountered this situation before. He never imagined that a ne'erdowell would refuse to rise in order to defend his or her point! And, he couldn't very well strike an opponent that wasn't properly prepared for battle... "Aha!" he shouted vigorously, "How would you feel, if-if I told you that I had recruited your ringleader to my side of the battle!" the Arcanine moemon reached behind him and pulled Midnight into the ring, much to her shock. "Haha! Truly you feel on equal terms with your old friendly rival?!"

There was a long pause...

"Midnight?" Eldreich asked in a bored tone.

The Mightyena moemon blushed profusely and ushered the loudmouthed moemon away. "Look Vayne, why don't you... um... go polish your goody two-shoes or something while I... uh, deal with Eldreich here." she said angrily. "Oh, of course my sidekick!" Vayne's deluded sense of reality kept him going strong even as Midnight turned it against him in an attempt to save face. "I believe you have my cell phone number, if there's any difficulty find the time to call me so that I may swoop in valiantly and-

"Yeah, yeah, swoop. Got it." Midnight said frantically as she pushed him back into his cart, "Don't forget to drive off a cliff, alright?"
***

"So, you and Vayne, huh?" Eldreich said, her voice high and nasal. It grated on Midnight's last ever-loving nerve every time she opened her mouth. It only hurt worse when it was something derogatory. "Oooh, how juicy." she said, biting ravenously into a half-melted prepackaged ice-cream cone. "But ew, how gross. I mean he's just so... freaky!" she went on, "Like there's something wrong with his brain or something." Midnight just waited her out, she couldn't go on forever. Her grimacing face and short sentences sold her actual lack of interest in the topic at hand. She was really just in it to bug Midnight.

"You done?" she finally asked

Eldreich nodded.

"Good." Midnight said curtly, "First, no, we're not dating. Second, we're not dating. Third, we will never be dating." Midnight barked, struggling to keep her eyes on the awkward lizard moemon sitting in front of her, "I don't know why you would ever pair me and that depraved lunatic together, but you need to stop it. Right now. I mean it, Eldreich. Right now." The Scrafty moemon rolled her golden brown eyes, "Sh'yeah, whatever." she said dismissively, "You want in on some of these things? I'm suuuuch a chocoholic right now." she said dreamily, "Couldn't afford to use those expensive-ass machines, so I broke one... they won't miss just one."

"I've forgotten what a weird little person you are."
1143122.title: You're just Awkward

choices: The two go search for another vending machine... They're still hungry?!
Nah, they decide to cause some trouble
11431222.content:
“Heh, I’m never one to deny a free breakfast,” Midnight snickered as she reached for the ever shrinking pile of ill-gotten snack foods. She wouldn’t admit it, especially to Eldreich, but the mocha skinned Mightyena was as much as a chocoholic as the Scrafty girl herself claimed herself to be. Maybe even more so.

Still, Midnight did know the effects of what this vice could do to a dynamite body like Midnight’s, so she couldn’t splurge like Eldreich was doing right now. The growing mountain of empty wrappers on the other side of the table was a testament to how much the Scrafty Moemon was putting away.

‘Damn, it was only a few minutes since she broke into that vending machine,’ Midnight thought to herself as she pulled one of the packages of chocolate cream donuts from the shrinking pile of pilfered food. ‘Where the heck is she putting it all.’

A little curious, Midnight leaned over slightly to get a better look at Eldreich and her eyes widened ever so slightly – around the usually trim, punk moemon’s waist was a layer of pudge! Nothing too big, but it was definitely noticeable since the Scrafty Moemon was wearing a shirt that showed off that pot belly in the making. Heck, Edlreich looked a little thicker everywhere! It was definitely showing too since she seemed to wear that orange hoodie every day and it was a little tighter on her frame than what Midnight, there was even the beginnings of a muffin top that oozed out from the top of her pants.

“What the hell are you doing?” Eldreich growled through a mouthful of purloined (ha ha! Loined) donuts.

“Oh nothing,” Midnight muttered out loud as she pulled back and ripped open the package. “Just seeing what you had in your pile.”

“Whatever,” Eldreich grumbled loudly before she swallowed and reached for another one of the packaged foods.

“Yeesh Eldreich, you’re really putting those away, haven’t you eaten over the summer?” Midnight pointed out before she tossed a donut into her mouth and began to chew on it… Taking a few moments to savor the amazing taste of the artificial sugar and cream that almost exploded in her mouth. ‘At least she’s got good taste, this stuff’s freakin’ amazing!’

“Meh, as subtle as usual,” Eldreich snarled loudly with her death glare aimed at Midnight. “But whatever, a little splurging here and there won’t kill me…”

‘No, but I’ll make you explode out of your clothes,’ Midnight snickered in her head as she started on the second donut from the package.

“… ‘sides, I got a taste of these things over the summer,” Eldreich admitted through a mouthful of chocolate cornet.

“Lemme guess, another one from your ‘free samples’?” Midnight questioned, subconsciously pulling out a second package of said free samples from the pile, having already finish the first package.

“Don’t get the wrong idea,” Eldreich spat back, waving one of the unopened packages at the Mightyena Moemon who was sitting across from her. “I’m not a fan of sweets, I just wanted to shut up a lousy whiny brat of a Snivy who…”

Midnight sighed as she drowned out the rest of Eldreich’s story. But from what she could tell, some Snivy Moemon had been bragging around Eldreich, annoying her to no end and as a way to shut her up, Eldreich snatched up the Snivy girl’s snack that was the same brand as the snacks that the two were eating right now. It was a little childish, but then again…

“Hey!”

Midnight’s ears perked up when that sudden shout caught her attention, making her gulp down the food that she had in her mouth. “What?”

“Thanks for eating the rest of my breakfast,” Eldreich spat with sarcasm dripping from her tongue.

Midnight blinked a few times, at the table before her… And realized that the large pile of snacks that the Scrafty Moemon she was sitting with had taken was now only a pile of empty wrappers that had the creamy and chocolate stains of some sort of snack food massacre. And the culprits were none other than the two girls seated at the table.

Licking some chocolate that had managed to escape from her lips, Midnight gulped down and waved her hand, “Damn…”

“Great,” Eldreich sighed as she spun around. “Now what?”
11431222.title: Summer Chubs on a Scrafty Girl

choices: to La Casa; the family that runs the place has grown... wow, insanely fat
actually yes: she is just in it for the popcorn but Midnight's not that better
114312222.content:
The mistress of mischief leaned back slightly as she struggled to bear the load on her overly stuffed stomach. At an obtuse angle, her back leaning hard against the back of the chair, Midnight had to struggle for comfort. Her stomach bloated pushed outwards slightly as the food inside slowly churned and digested- probably adding an inch and a pound here and there knowing her luck. While it was certainly a consolation that she wouldn't end up quite the edging porker that Eldreich showed the potential to be, she certainly didn't want to get to a point where she had to console herself with "at least I'm not as heavy as her". That just wasn't her style. Thankfully though, one little slip wouldn't put Midnight in that position; thus meaning that this groaning tummy of hers could easily be worked off with a quick lap of the island... or two, judging by the strain on her shorts' button. As she forced herself into a recline, her callused (though perfectly manicured) hands traveled to the convex of her belly- instinctively rubbing the dome.

"Ugh, I am stuffed." she said remorsefully, giving her midsection a light slap, "I don't think I've ever eaten that much crap in my entire life."

From across the table, Eldreich didn't share quite the same sentiment. As evidenced by her ability to move with relative ease within her seat (give or take a few grunts) underneath Eldreich's slight paunch belied a belly aching to be stuffed silly. Apparently, an entire mountain of junkfood just wasn't enough for the starving Scrafty girl; the hungry glimmering in her golden eyes was all the tell that Midnight needed to see that Eldreich had been quite busy indulging herself over the Summer. "Well hi Stuffed. I'm Bored." she said sarcastically, bringing up one booted foot to balance on the edge of the table while she lay an arm over the back of her chair and pick at her teeth. "And frankly Stuffed, I could probably use just a little bit more to eat right about now. Whats say we knock over another one of those rich-kid vendors and resume our breakfast?" she asked greedily, obviously near salivating at the mere thought of more delicious goodies to stuff her kraut with.

Midnight looked down at her for-now partner's blossoming waistline and grimaced, "Eh, I don't think so Eldreich." Midnight said in a wishy-washy tone, "I mean, I'm pretty full. You sure you wouldn't rather... I don't know, go hit on anything that moves or go hassle a shop keep?" The sand dweller snorted, a toothy smile (but then, all her expressions seemed to be toothy) creased her thin lips. "You're so desperate." she said in a generous tone, "But alright, I guess I should be keeping all the sweets I can away from you, huh you Chocolate Spaz?" Midnight snarled back, a friendly snarl if that was possible, "Hey, I'm just naming off things that I've seen you do, Eldy." she jeered, "And I'm not a spaz... I'm a recovering Chocoholic thank you very much Ms. Snack Machine Bandit."

Eldreich grinned and turned to her right, "Yeah, yeah whatever." she said dismissively. As she attempted to stand, it was quite obvious to at least Midnight that dear old Eldy might have bitten off a little more than she could chew. Underneath her tattered black top, a belly significantly rounder than it had been before they had met stood out loud and proud as it hung ever so slightly over her tight burgundy perhaps-not-so skinny jeans. All that food was going to go somewhere, apparently, and it would certainly take some time for that belly to deflate back to just plain paunchy. However... she was really in no shape for judgement. Her own stomach, bulging ever so slightly underneath her much more modest silver reflective tube top was probably just as painful as Eldreich's. The light mocha dome sat restlessly atop her perfectly sculpted abdominals, not so much mocking her as much as goading her. Goading her into solitude, so as to wait until it deflated to her normally perfect bod. But that wasn't really an option right now, especially given that the rock-hard midsection she sported would make all those flashy acrobatic moves she performed not even three hours ago all but impossible.

There was a long pause between the two as Midnight continued to stare down her belly. Seriously; stare down her belly. Her head was almost at a perfect one-eighty degree angle as she craned her neck to glare into the taut tummy of sweets and other sugary spenditude. The Mightyena girl let out a small growl as she contemplated just how round she was when full. It was almost illogical- but then considering that the food had to go somewhere, she wasn't at so much of a loss.

"Hey." Eldreich said abruptly, tearing the Mightyena girl from her knuckle-whiteningly strong interest in her bloated middle, "You gonna spend all day staring at your gut or are we gonna go make a ruckus?" the Scrafty girl said with a hungry look in her golden eyes. Of course she meant exactly what she said; its just that she planned on taking more than a few slaps on the wrist from the few vigilantes that roamed the academy. In that she was probably intently set on looting every shape, form, or state of snack food matter for herself. Her appetite, thanks to these high-class sweets that had so mysteriously been adopted into the Gijinka Academy way of life, she was hopelessly hooked. Or it at least appeared that way. There might be a point of return from here, but this is really a topic for another time...

"Yeah yeah, whatever Chubs." Midnight said dismissively, unknowingly upsetting Eldreich's defensive sense of denial. "And whats that supposed to mean?!" she asked in an elevated voice, hands balled up beside her waist in anger, "You're the one with that huge gut!"

"Yeah, but by sundown I'll have it all digested." Midnight said mockingly, "Your summer blubber's apparently grabbed an extended trip and then some." she snickered, much to Eldreich's chagrin. "Whatever, okay!" she shouted, cheeks growing flushed in anger and embarrassment, "J-Just what do we do from here?" she demanded with her usual brand of indignant scrappiness. "Fine, fine, no need to get so worked up." Midnight said knowingly. "We could always hang out at that hispanic store. The stuff's really cheap there..."

"What does price matter if we're going to steal the food?"

"What?"

"Nothing."

"-Anyway, La Casa is probably our safest bet y'know. The family's all nice and junk, so they won't suspect a thing." Midnight said nonchalantly, picking between her sharp teeth for remnants of solid sweets that may have gotten lodged up into her gums. "Look at you, Ms. Heartless." Eldreich said coldly, but not without a sense of pride detectable in her voice, "Should I tell Vayne that you've been re-assimilated into Ne'redowelldome?" Eldreich said in a snotty voice. "Wow, that was a lot of big words for you, Eldy~" Midnight mocked, finding a bit of taffy, "I'm really proud of you- Summer School actually did you some good!" Said lizard-based moemon rolled her eyes, "Shut up Fuzzy. I don't really wanna go there, their daughter -Miss GoodyTwoShoes Luca- is such a pain."

"What, you don't like Luca?"

"I hate her."

"She's a Ludicolo moemon, how can you hate her?"

"I just do!"

"Whatev." Midnight said with a frenchman's wave, jumping to her feet with a bit of difficulty due to her swelling midsection. She noticed with a sort of wicked glee that as Eldreich followed suit, the ring of fat under her shirt's edge jiggled one good time as her feet made impact with the ground. "I think we should head over to La Casa. What's your big idea Sheds-for-Brains?" Eldreich thought for a second before a look of realization hit her face, "We could sneak go see that new Don Walrein film at the Cinema." she said with some detectable excitement in her voice. "You excited about the movie or the popcorn, Chubs?"

"KNOCK IT OFF!"
114312222.title: the Weapon of Choice

choices: After Midnight and Eldreich enter the theatre, the Riolu Moemon sits before them
1143122222.content:
Gijinka Cinemas – The only movie theatre that was on the entire island, which meant it was a normal hotspot for all of the young students of the island. Of course, with it being the first day of classes and a majority of students in classes, the theatre was practically a ghost town. However, not all the youthful students were in classes - the seniors had the first two periods of class off, those with club activities were doing their best to prepare for the year, and those who were just skipping their classes.

Hence why we had the slightly bloated Mightyena bad girl and chubby Scrafty punk girl were walking into the main lobby of the movie theatre. Although, the two of them were currently discussing something of the utmost importance…

“Never pegged you as a Don Walrein fan,” Midnight snickered with her arms thrown over her head as the two slipped into the lush lobby of the theatre. “Any reason why?”

“And if I’m a fan?” Eldreich spat back, walking a little bit faster (although, there were signs that her walk was beginning to look like a waddle with her thighs rubbing against each other in her pants) to get in front of Midnight. “What’s your point?”

Midnight only shrugged in reply, either Eldreich was truly a fan, or she didn’t want to admit that she was in only for the popcorn… Then again, popcorn did sound good to the Mightyena girl, and besides, a movie was the perfect way to skip out on the classes that Midnight didn’t really have a care for. “You just didn’t strike as a fan of his…”

‘Although, taking into account your ‘enhanced’ figure, it would make sense.’

“Move your tail!”

Midnight shook her head and followed the Scrafty girl deeper into the theatre, taking note that Eldreich’s behind was so big that her pants looked to be painted on her tush, and swished left and right with each step that the punk girl took. With a second shake of her head, Midnight reminded herself that she wouldn’t end up like that… With no self control with what she ate.

‘All I have to do is keep up my exercise,’ the Mightyena girl thought as she quickly followed her fellow delinquent towards the screens that listed the times of the current movies. ‘I won’t let myself go like Eld here did.’

“We got about fifteen minutes till the flick starts,” Eldreich grumbled as she fitted her hands into her tight pants’ pockets. “And it looks like they stepped up security over the summer… Cheh.”

Midnight looked around, and indeed, there were more ushers around than last year – And they weren’t the geeky Magikarp and lazy Dunsparce Moemon that the Mightyena girl remembered from before the summer. Instead, there were a few Gyarados, Ursaring, and… Was that an Aggron Moemon?! Yep! And even though they were dressed in those geeky red uniforms, they still looked like they could easily tear the slim (if not sporting a little gut) Mightyena and slightly chubby Scrafty girls in two if they were caught sneaking into the movie theatre.

But aside from the staff, it was if the two ditching Moemon girls were the only ones in the theatre.

“Is it still too late to hit La Casa?” Midnight muttered out loud with her eyes turning slightly dull.

“Humph, go ahead and ditch, mutt,” Eldreich stated as she walked towards the ticket counter. “More popcorn for me.”

Midnight rolled her eyes, at this point, she was just too tired to really even care to walk the distance to La Casa – Heck, she was really hating herself for not stealing Vayne’s stolen golf cart earlier, it would’ve made getting around the island easier.

Besides, a movie with moderate snacks was probably better than having Mexican food for breakfast (or brunch as it were).

A few minutes after getting their tickets (which were actually on discount since they were both students), they were both standing in front of the snack counter where a slightly chubby Flaffy girl getting Eldreich’s order down. “Give me your moviegoer’s special, and go heavy on the extra butter.”

‘Moviegoer’s special,’ Midnight read in her head. ‘Extra large tub of popcorn, extra large soda of choice, and two candies of choice… Damn! I was just kidding about the popcorn, but damn! And its only four dollars?!’

As Midnight was thinking all of this, the chubby Flaffy girl was quickly getting the order ready (with record time speed) and placed the large order out on the counter in front of her. “Enjoy! Next please.”

Eldreich licked her lips slightly as she pulled the snack food away from the counter, trying to make sure she didn’t drop any on the ground. Midnight shrugged her shoulders and turned her attention to the Flaffy counter girl. “Yeah, I’ll just have a small coke and medium popcorn with regular butter.”

“Would you like to make both of them a large?” The Flaffy attendant asked with a warm smile on her chubby face. “It’s only fifty cents more.”

“Nah I’m…” Midnight started until she heard a little grumble coming from her stomach, which made her narrow her eyes. ‘What the hell? I just ate a whole bunch of snacks! How the hell am I hungry?!’

“Miss? Are you alright?” The Flaffy attendant asked with a concerned look on her face.

“Huh, yeah, sure, fine,” Midnight muttered, putting the money she owed on the counter. “Just do whatever.”

“Right away!” The Flaffy counter girl answered back.

A few moments later, Midnight was met with a large popcorn and large soda on the counter in front of her, not that she really cared. With a sigh, Midnight began to turn around with the snack foods in her arms, and almost knocked into someone who was standing right behind her. “Hey! Watch it… you…”

“Sorry, I didn’t think you’d turn around.”

Midnight didn’t finish her sentence, cause as soon as she looked at who was in front of her now (although, to be perfectly honest, he was standing behind her, but that was a technicality) she was shocked stunned by the very handsome face that was looking right back at her with bright gold eyes. After a few moments, Midnight stepped back and got a better look at the owner of those golden colored eyes.

He was a young man, long black hair that had two tails of black hair styled to fall to his shoulders. His slim body was covered with a blue denim vest, black t-shirt underneath and he had deep navy blue jean shorts wrapped around his slim waist. From the tanned skin and youthful face this handsome young man had, Midnight could only help but blink a few times at him – Unaware that there was a small streak of crimson dashing her cheeks that she had at the sight of this Riolu Moemon.

The young man could only shrug his shoulders before he walked past her and began to place an order from the Flaffy girl attendant. Midnight shook her head and slowly walked away from the counter to follow Eldreich into the theatre…
1143122222.title: Extra Large Popcorn! Double Butter on the Side!

choices: Midnight ditches Eldy after the movie in favor of some shorter company...
Midnight just can't stop eating this popcorn and counting down every 15 minutes!
11431222221.content:
"Do you really think its healthy to stuff so much crap in your kraut?"

Eldreich let a deep belch rise from her seemingly permanently scowling demure in response, taking time to down another handful of popcorn before answering; "Nah, its just the butter that'll kill ya. No one ever died from Popcorn Overdose- you know, except that one time." she crunched away noisily at the popped kernels, "Besides, you got just as much crap as I did Fluffy, so who's the hypocrite?"

As the two troublemakers make their way down the aisle towards the large silver screen and its rising rows of seats, they had taken it upon themselves to begin feasting readily on their purchased foodstuffs. With a wobbling belly bobbing ahead of her every step, Eldreich openly gorged upon her buttery delights. Next to her, a still stuffed-taut Midnight was a little more wary; namely in the face of how much Eldreich had already consumed today. It wasn't even lunchtime yet and she'd eaten more junk than most people eat food in a day! Though in all truth, she was guilty of a little overconsumption herself this morning... all those sweets were probably a really bad idea for her girlish figure...

"Yo, Tick Bait, you listening to me?" Eldreich huffed unpleasantly,

The addressed moemon's attention snapped from the hypnotic jiggling and swaying of Eldreich's flabby middle to the asymmetrical girl herself. "Hm? What?" she asked flatly, taking time to realize just how round dear ol' Eldy's face was getting in the cheeks.

"I asked if you thought that little shortstack back there was a cutie," Eldreich repeated begrudgingly, "But I see that you're obviously still daydreaming about Vayne."

Midnight turned a little red at the smarmy Scrafty's suggestion, puffing out her cheeks ever so slightly before responding in a huff, "N-Not in your lifetime, Side-Hair!" she corrected sternly, "I would never, ever daydream about that pompous, mask-and-cape brained, fireheaded loser!"

"Ooooh~" Eldreich teased as she pawed at her bucket, searching for the ones with them most lubrication, "So I take it you were daydreaming about Sweet 'n' Low?"

"N-No!!"

They came to the end of the aisle and made a ninety-degree turn to face the rows. Midnight had spent many a school day hiding out in the movie theater; in most cases literally, as if she had been found she would have been surely been dragged back to class. So it was a little bit of a shock to see just what had been done to one of her favorite places to pass time of three years (give or take a failed one here or there) in little less than four months.

The renovation bill at St. Gijinka's was no doubt astronomical, and it probably required a good bit of strong strapping moemon to carry out the job. That or magic. Where there used to be about thirty or so rows that went up to the wall, it was now probably about seventy. It wasn't obvious to someone who hadn't partaken in a movie there, but to Midnight it was just that; this room went back twice as far as before! The silver screen was still exactly the same length in front of the aisle as ever, but there was another tier of seats above what used to be the back of the theater, and then another one after that! There were more than twice as many places to sit now; 'twice as many places to hide', Midnight made sure to make a mental note.

"Wow..." Midnight gasped as she took in the ever familiar dragon mural on the walls, the school's mascots being the majestic dragon-types. A Rayquaza took center as two Dragonair wrapped around it in a double-helix formation. Below it, a Gyarados firing a wicked hyperbeam into the corner of the sky and behind a matching set of Dragonite. "When did they have time to do all of this?" Midnight asked aloud as she was taken into an awestruck art appreciation

"Oh, dey did all dish crap over the Shummer." Eldreich said through yet another mouthful of popcorn, "I didn't get to see any of it done though, I kinda liked the old way better."

"Yeah, that's right... you pretty much had total control of the school while all us people who didn't have to go to Summer School were home." Midnight teased, taking her first piece of popcorn from the bucket, "You know all the improvements, don't you?"

"Nah." Eldreich answered plainly, "All I know is that they redid the cafeteria, some of the theaters, like where they show the movies and stuff- ugh, you know- , um the grocery store, the candy shop, and installed all those vending machines."

"Jeez Eldy, did you do anything in summer school?"

"Nope, Don Stupid says I've gotta repeat my sophomore year." she griped through buttery lips, "Its whatevs though, I hate school."

Midnight rolled her eyes and started up the stairs. Eldreich was becoming a real butterball inside and out these days, and Midnight couldn't help but worry just a little. She didn't really like Eldreich per say; nor her mannerisms, the company she kept, her style, her stupid yellow jacket with eye holes ripped out of the hood, her fool's gold earrings, her stupid red hair or how it was cut, or... alright, she just didn't like Eldreich. But still, it was rather strange to see someone once so violence hungry just get so... hungry. She hadn't seen Eldreich go less than thirty minutes without eating in the hour or so they'd been hanging out, and that was on the walk to the movies! It was unnerving, yet she just kept eating!

The Mighteyena moemon was halfway up the first staircase when Eldreich suddenly decided to settle into row.

"What do you think you're doing?" Midnight asked rather disgruntled, "You're supposed to sit at the top of the seats."

"That's so mainstream." Eldreich said defensively, her breathing a little labored from those stairs, "There's nothing wrong with these seats, plus we're closer so we can see just the movie, you know?"

"Plus you're closer, so you can ruin your eyesight faster, you know?"

"Oh wow, thanks a lot Mom, when did you get all that new doghair?" Eldreich chided, "Just sit here, okay? Trust me."

Once again, Midnight rolled her eyes and started down the row, sitting next to Eldreich (as she didn't want to have to go over her in case she decided to bail if the movie sucked) and plopped her firm denim-draped rear down into the plush confines of the seat. At once, a strange sensation of vibration went through her body. She jumped immediately before sinking further into the chair. "Oh my God..." Midnight groaned, "Don't tell me they actually put vibrating seats in here?"

"Every fifteen minutes you get a nice cool vibration so your butt doesn't get sore." Eldreich said with a smirk, getting more popcorn from between her legs, "We tested them out in Summer School.. w-when I actually went y'know?"

As Midnight sank and allowed the pulsating massage to permeate her back and glutes, she found her hand reaching for her own popcorn bucket placed in the seat beside her. The massage chair seemed to even reach her stomach, a strange sense of aching relaxation coursed out from her ailing tummy. "Mmm..." she moaned quietly as she bit into the suddenly a lot more compelling popcorn...

When they (well, she) saw a familiar face go up the stairs; that cute little Riolu moemon was carrying a large drink up the steps coolly as he continued to climb the tiers. "Ooh, there goes Midnight's sweet lovin'." Eldreich teased, "I'll bet you want a piece of that."

"A-As if Eldreich!"
11431222221.title: Vrrrrt.

choices: "I was gonna hit up La Casa for some lunch, you want to join me?"
"Uh..." Writer's choice
114312222211.content:
While the movie was interesting to say the least, Midnight was more preoccupied with the fact of the cute little Riolu kid who sat about two seats in front of her and Eldreich… That and the almost bottomless bucket of popcorn that she kept diving her hand into every few seconds to fill her need for the buttery and salty movie snack.

Between the movie and the Riolu cutie, Midnight didn’t realize that with each mouthful of popcorn that she stuffed in her mouth, she kept getting fuller and fuller. It was a standard movie effect, while you enjoyed the movie and you had a snack or so, you subconsciously eat whatever’s in front of you, not really caring about how much you ate or even what you ate.

And with the fact that there was a cutie in near her, the effect was amplified.

The only thing that was prevent Midnight from going all gung-ho and stuffing herself like a tick, was the pudgy Eldriech who had somehow managed to inhale all of the extra large bucket of popcorn within the first half of the movie. Eldriech kept sneaking her hand into Midnight’s bucket of popcorn, stealing a handful of the buttery goodness every few minutes.

Not that Midnight noticed this, once again, she was too engrossed with the movie and the passing glances she gave to the Riolu Moemon in front of her.

------------


“Meh, well, that killed some time,” Eldriech stated as she lifted her hand up to block the bright sunlight that was pouring down from the sky above. “Ugh, I hate that after movie glare. So, tick bait, wanna crash a few more vending machines for some more free samples?”

… No response.

“I thought mutts were supposed to have good hearing!” Eldriech spat as she spun around to see Midnight staggering out of the movie theater, her hands on her stomach.

“Get off my case snake-skin,” Midnight growled back as she slowly stood up straight to continue her walk towards the plump Scraggy moemon. “I really don’t need you riding my hide. Sides, I got better things to do now…”

“Going scavenging among the freshmen?” Eldriech sighed with a roll of her eyes. “First the ‘hero of justice’, now some freshmeat? Yeesh, you just have no real standards when it comes to men, do ya?”

“At least I can get a man,” Midnight countered with her arms crossed under her breasts. “When was the last time you got some action?”

“Feh, I’ll date someone who isn’t an idiot,” Eldriech countered with her eyes narrowed down at Midnight as she placed her hands on her chunky hips. “Which means I haven’t found someone… I’m being tolerant enough by talking to a number of people who are barely on that line.”

Midnight’s eyes dulled a little bit and shifted her gaze to the building, she knew she was being insulted here, but she didn’t want to scare the cutie away if he caught her getting into a fight with Eldy here. So with a deep breath, Midnight raised one of her hands up. “Whatever, look, it was fun killing a couple of hours with ya, but I’m sure you don’t wanna kill the rest of the day arguing with me. I know you’ve got better things you wanna do than haggle me.”

“Then you obviously haven’t been paying attention,” Eldriech muttered under her breath as she spun around, her exposed gut jiggling with the movement. “Feh, fine, I’m outta here then. I’ll see you around, tick bait.”

And with that, the chunky Eldriech began to walk away, and it was not a moment too later, cause just as Eldriech’s wide behind was turning the corner around the movie theater, that Riolu freshman guy was just exiting the movie theater, looking at his hand and was using his other hand to count something. The young Riolu simply counting some change that he had in his hand (Midnight was able to see that when the blue and dark haired moemon walked past her).

Midnight watched as the Riolu slowly walked away, she couldn’t help but take a gander at him again – Blue vest, black shirt, and blue jean shorts, all of those clothes clinging to his slightly muscular frame. He had a tight body and with his cute innocent face and wild hair, Midnight couldn’t help but lick her lips.

Freshmen.

So fresh.

So young.

So energetic.

So… Innocent.

Now, while those were all good points, Midnight knew that freshmen scared easily (even the most confident ones got a little scared of upper classmen approaching them, especially on the first day), so she had to play her cards right and get the right impression with this Riolu.

Like a hyena stalking its prey, Midnight carefully and discreetly followed the younger student, watching him as he walked through the small town on campus. It wasn’t long till she saw what his destination was – It was a vending machine! But it wasn’t one of the new ones that riddled the entire campus now, it was an older one that just served drinks and such. One of the faulty ones that Midnight had learned stole money from her while trying to get something to drink…

… But this was exactly what Midnight was hoping for. The Freshman Riolu was putting those coins of his into the machine. Knowing exactly what was going to happen, Midnight adjusted her shirt, pulling it down over the taught dome that was her belly while at the same time, making sure that her cleavage was shown, not too much, but enough to catch the wandering eyes of some freshly hormone induced freshman.

BAM!

With the sound of the Riolu kicking the vending machine, Midnight realized that was her cue and slowly sauntered over to the vending machine that was getting kicked by the freshman. When she arrived, the freshman Riolu had his shoulders slumped and was just about to turn away…

“Hmm, this thing giving you trouble, darling?” Midnight cooed as she placed her arm on the side of the machine.

The Riolu moemon turned around, and turned his gaze slightly to the side when he saw Midnight (although the slight blush on his face didn’t go unnoticed by the Mightyena girl) talking to him. Midnight mentally smirked to herself as she slightly pushed herself from the machine, “This old thing always steals money from unsuspecting students, all you gotta do is have the magic touch.”

The Riolu guy turned back to Midnight as he watched her bump the side of her hip into the side of the vending machine. Oddly enough, the sound of plastic on metal echoed from the machine until a soft impact echoed from the opening in the machine. The Riolu was a little surprised, so Midnight continued her assault and leaned forward to reach for the drinks in the machine…

Which gave the Riolu freshman a decent view down her top, just on the fringe of the black bra she was wearing, and the blush on his tanned face grew slightly. Once again, Midnight smirked inside her head as she stood up and held up the bottled soft drink up to the Riolu freshman. “I hope this is what you wanted…”

It took a moment for it to register in the Riolu’s mind, but he quickly accepted the drink, “Uh, yeah, thanks.”

‘Hmm, looks like I got a bite,’ Midnight thought as she leaned against the vending machine again. “Since you got suckered by this machine, I assume you’re a freshman, right?”

“Y-Yes,” the Riolu freshman stated with a slight bow towards Midnight.

“Hmm, aren’t you supposed to be in class right now?” Midnight asked as she moved a little closer to the reddening Riolu freshman, a small coy, if not seductive smirk growing on her face.

“Well, I have a reason for not being in class,” the Riolu replied as he slowly opened the bottle. But he stopped when he realized that Midnight lifted up her hand.

“Ah, there’s not need to explain yourself to me, freshman,” Midnight playfully said watching as the freshman began to drink from the soda. “But, you got a name? It would kind of a shame to not get a chance to know some of the new faces around here, especially one that’s easy on the eyes.”

The Riolu nearly gagged on the soda when he heard Midnight say that, Midnight playfully giggled at the flustered Riolu as he slowly began to regain his composure. After a few coughs, the Riolu Freshman stood up straight, trying to remain calm, “L… Lucas.”

“Hmm, very nice,” Midnight stated as she inched closer to Lucas. “People around here call me Midnight, so, feel free to do so… Tell me Lucas, would you like to kill some time with me?”

Lucas jumped slightly, nearly dropping the soda in his hands when Midnight offered the invitation to him, it wasn’t every day that an attractive young (although slightly older than him) woman would just offer to spend time with him just like that. But here was the opportunity…

Lucas took a deep breath and calmly answered…
114312222211.title: The Midnight Charm

choices: Midnight agrees. She really doesn't have anything better to do right now.
Midnight declines. She's still a bit suspicious of those products.
1143122222112.content:
"Uh..." the Riolu moemon began to say.

"Yes?" inquired Midnight, as she smiled. I've got him now, she thought.

"I'd l-love to... b-but... I can't." stammered Lucas, "I'm really sorry." And with that, he took a few steps back and ran off.

Midnight was speechless. How did my charms not work? They've never failed me before! she thought, just standing there in shock.

In actuality, Midnight's charms had worked just fine. The problem was that Lucas already HAD a girlfriend. Yup, he was one of those lucky guys who ended up going to the same academy as his girlfriend. Even though their schedules hardly matched up, Lucas and his girlfriend, a Mienfoo moemon, made sure they had at least one day together. In fact, that's why Lucas wasn't in class, he arranged with the dean to get night classes so he could spend time with his beloved during the day.

But of course, Midnight didn't know this.

Midnight continued to remain motionless until she heard snickering coming from behind her. She turned around to find none other than Eldriech standing there, laughing at her expense.

"Wha... How long have you been there?" inquired Midnight.

"Long enough." chortled Eldreich. "Wow, I guess your charms really do have an effect on people!"

Midnight's face turned a bright red "Shuddup!" she replied.

"Why don't you use your "charms" on Vayne? Maybe then he'll stop bothering us."

"SHUT IT!" shouted Midnight.

"So you do like him, then?" Eldreich retorted with a sly smile.

"No, I already told you I didn't! Just drop this whole thing already!"

"Ok, ok, fine." groaned Eldreich. "And I was just starting to have fun with it, too. Anyway... seeing you have nothing to do anymore... I'll propose my offer from before to you again. Wanna go trash some vending machines with me for more free samples?"
1143122222112.title: Rejected!

choices: Head to Orientation where she meets the rest of her freshman class!
Or she could run into her other roomie: a certain no good Mightyena girl...
Alternatively she could get caught by a teacher for "skipping" on her first day!
Alternatively still, there's another choice out there...
Even more alternatively, you could just pick.
12.content:
The dorms in St. Gijinka's Academy for Young Moemon, building D are prone to short circuiting.

Whether it be due to shoddy wiring in that particular building or due to the large population of electric type students that had populated that area for the past four years, it always seemed that at least once a week the building's power would flicker for a bit before going dead for a complete thirty seconds; only to turn back on not even a minute later. Those who have been living here for some time have learned not to rely on things like alarm clocks or radios to wake them up in the morning. However, this is a habit developed out of necessity, and often enough the students don't even notice it anymore. So its only natural that when someone fills in an empty slot in the dorm rooms, they find it a little hard to adjust at first...

"Aliiiii..." a hum from her bedroom door sounded as her roommate quietly tiptoed her way into the Quilava's den. Outstretching an arm to rouse her slumbering friend, the good natured intruder gave the smaller girl an innocent nudge. "Hmmm..." she sounded as she looked over the sleeping body of her little buddy. Clearly Ali hadn't taken her warnings and had gotten little to no sleep last night. Placing her elbow in the palm of her hand and nestling her chin into the groove between her index finger and thumb, Fontina let out a low grumble, "Oh gosh, I told her not to stay up so late." she chastised the slumbering moemon. "Aliii... come on, wake up." Fontina pleaded as she continued to poke and prod at Ali's unmoving form. "Omigosh, do you think she's... no, she couldn't be!" at once Fontina's fiction-riddled brain took siege over her normally rational way of thinking, "Oh no, she's dead! Her heart must have given out from all the excitement of coming to St. Gijinka's!!" she wailed, "Oh how could this have happened to her?!"

With all of Fontina's blabbering, it was no shock when Ali's petite shape rolled over underneath the covers, mumbling quietly to herself in her sleep. "Ali?!" Fontina rushed to her side as she soon realized that her friend was not in fact, dead, "You're alive!" Fontina squealed with glee as she quickly roused the girl up into a sitting position in her sleep.

"Ugh... was I not supposed to be?" Ali yawned as she rubbed her heavy eyelids. "What time is it?"

Fontina was snapped back to reality as she remembered just what it was she came into Ali's room to do anyway. "Oh, its um...9" she said meekly, lips narrowing in her embarrassment, "I figured that I should wake you up before I left."

There was a full three seconds of silence between the two of them. Slowly, Ali's dark eyes widened as her sleep raddled brain processed the number she had just been given. "9." she repeated in a dull, almost monotonous voice. "Uh... yeah..." Fontina smiled sheepishly as she noticed Ali's knuckles whiten. She took a step back away from the bed as she anticipated what was sure to come.

Sure enough: "HOLY CRAP, NINE IN THE FREAKING MORNING?!" Ali shouted as she tore off her blankets and rushed towards the bathroom. "Well you just looked so peaceful!" Fontina cooed apologetically as she watched Ali ready herself in their restroom. "And you couldn't have woken me up!?" she snapped back, sending fracture lines running up her toothbrush and a little ember from her mouth. "Well, I had just came back from the library and Midnight told me not to..." Fontina shied away as Ali returned to furiously beating the plaque away from her teeth with her toothbrush. "crap, Crap, CRAP!!" Ali hollered as she pulled off her yellow nightie and grabbed one of her many red-plaid skirts from her closet, "Great, no time for a shower... ugh, whore's bath in the sink!" she instructed aloud as she grabbed the soap and washcloth and began rubbing herself down with both of them. "Ali, just calm down!" Fontina pleaded, "I'm sure there's plenty of time to get you some breakfast before second period starts-

"Don't talk to me for the rest of the morning!" Ali spat fervently as she attempted to brush her teeth, comb her hair, and bathe herself at the same time.
