Finally she reached something somewhat decent. Not perfect, but decent. She pulled up her skirt, grabbed her pullover, rolled up the sleeves, got some socks, and slipped on her shoes before she started towards the door. She was stopped just at the doorway by her longtime friend, Fontina; her heavy breasts smooshing right into Ali's face. "Ali slow down." Fontina chided calmly as she held the little spitfire at arm's length, "No one's going to be mad if you miss your Freshman Orientation."

Ali glared, only to be met with Fontina's kindly smile. She didn't really have a choice in the matter; Fontina may have been a bookworm, but all those hours lifting books in the library had made her pretty strong! The small moemon took a deep breath and exhaled warmly. "There, good." Fontina said in a motherly tone, "Look, you've gone and undone all the hard work you did on your hair." Fontina teased as she fixed the loose strands that Ali had left untouched in her hurry.

She was a pretty girl by all means, whore's bath or not. With tanned skin, a small frame, and a lovely face. Her jaw was small but sturdy, and her complexion usually clear as crystal. Her hair was predominately black, but grew gradually more of a burgundy as one reached the tips. But most of all; she was short. Like, really short. Four foot ten. It was really kinda cute actually, but her total lack of curves got her mistaken for a boy quite a lot. Fontina could only smile as she remembered the days when she was just a little cyndaquil moemon tugging at her skirt. But now, here she was; all grown up and enrolled in the very Academy of which she herself was about to graduate.

"Thanks Fontina." Ali said apologetically, "I'm sorry, its just... I'm all wound up for today..."

She smiled up into Fontina's glasses and caught reflection of herself; all grown up and in school. The same school her mother, father, and brother had gone to when they were her age. It was a really humbling experience. "I understand. I was exactly the same way when I was a freshman." Fontina said with a distinct tone of nostalgia in her voice, "I think all of us are... um, anyway, go on and get to orientation!" Fontina urged, back to her rather excitable self, "Or... what's left of it." she smiled sheepishly, "Again, I'm really sorry for not waking you up sooner." she oozed.

"It's cool!" Ali said as she stormed out the door...

...before poking her head back in the door with an intimidatingly blank expression on her face:

"But if you ever let me sleep in that late again, I'll pop your bubble boobies with a fork."
12.title: Ali - The Rising Star of the Academy

choices: Vayne, the Arcanine, manages to get Ali there in the middle of the orientation
The two litterally run into someone!
Or... Something else could happen.
121.content:
“STUPID LOUSY ALARM CLOCK!” Ali roared to herself as she ran out of the Gijinki Dorm Building D, trying to make up the lost time she had lost thanks to that lousy no good Midnight.

If that damn mutt got her in trouble, Ali was going to get her revenge, that was a given.

But at the moment, Ali was more interested in getting to the main building of the academy – As fast as her little legs could take her. Of course, it didn’t matter if she was as fast as that Jolteon girl that Ali saw running around yesterday (seriously, that girl ran like crazy around the place), the distance between the dorms and the main building was at least a fifteen minute jog.

And with that empty stomach and slight fatigue from staying up late last night (once again, thanks to that mutt of a roommate – Midnight), Ali was unaware how long it would take till she collapsed onto the ground and become officially late for the orientation…

‘Shake it off Ali!’ The Quilava Moemon thought to herself as she ran even faster and faster in an attempt to get to the auditorium. ‘Just keep running and you’ll be able to make it.’

TTTTTTTT


Ali wasn’t the only one walking around the island this morning, but most of the others were pretty lax about it. One in particular was currently taking an easy jog towards the school, a large smile on his face that grew with every step he took, “Ah, a new semester, a brand new chance to meet new people and a chance to see what the next generation has to offer!”

The young man laughed loudly as he adjusted the large metal baseball bat he had over his shoulder, making sure that the large bag that was strapped to the baseball bat wouldn’t fall off. He was a brash looking young man with messy, dirty blond hair that billowed over his broad shoulders, and his skin was a light bronze, one of the many traits that highlighted his active life style. He wore a black wife-beater underneath a baggy red baseball jersey that highlighted his athletic body. He was also wearing some old, beaten up black pants but that’s highly irrelevant, unlike the deep, stripe-like scars that were around his neck. An Arcanine Moemon, and one that was well off to boot.

It was a little off putting that he had a large goofy grin on his face, but the man just continued his trek through the school grounds… At least until…

“HEY! OUTTA THE WAY!!”

The burly Arcanine turned to the left, just in time to have a familiar Quilava freshman ram into him. However, due to the difference in sizes, the Arcanine Moemon didn’t even move an inch while Ali was sent to the ground, making the young freshman wince. “OW! Hey! Watch where you’re going!”

The Arcanine Moemon smirked to himself as he shook his head, “If I recall, you were the one who crashed into me. What’s your rush, shorty?”

“I don’t have time to waste with you!” Ali yelped as she jumped to her feet, and began to dash off. “I’m not going to make it to orientation!”

The Arcanine tilted his head slightly, and smirked, “Freshman, eh?”

With a quick look around, the Arcanine smirked at what he was looking for, “Hmm, nothing like adding a flair for the dramatics on the first day!”

Meanwhile…

“Stupid lousy… Why are so many people trying to make me late today!?” Ali yelled at no one in particular as she continued her race to get to orientation.

“Hey!”

“Huh?” Ali questioned as she turned to the side just in time to see the very same Arcanine she just bumped into right beside her… The only difference this time was that he was driving what seemed to be a fancy red cart. “What the?”

“Hop in!” the Arcanine requested with a large smile. “This thing will get you there in two minutes at top speed!”

“What?!” Ali questioned.

But before the Quilava Freshman could deny or accept, the Arcanine Moemon reached over and lifted Ali up by the back of her hoodie, and immediately plopped her into the seat next to him. “Off!”

“No need to worry!” the Arcanine laughed loudly. “I Vayne will not allow you to be late on your first day, now hold onto something, newbie!”

That’s when the cart seemed to go a lot faster, making Ali grab onto the dashboard of the vehicle (which had the name Mr. Sunny written on it). “AAAAAAAAAAAAHHHH!”
121.title: Dashing to Orientation

choices: Ugh, after orientation Ali's got science class (with an Aipom girl named April)
No, wait, it's Special Moves! (with a heavyset Vulpix moemon named Ember)
Or... maybe not; considering Midnight's waiting for her outside!
1211.content:
The little red speedster lived up to Vayne's profession; it zipped and weaved effortlessly between the pueblos and alleyways that entailed St. Giginka's Academy. The diminutive spitfire girl managed to get a firm grip on the underside of the dashboard, clenching tightly out of fear for her own safety, as she was comically strewn about the vehicle despite her vice-like grip on the plastic. Vayne was a reckless driver, who just barely dodged obstacles and completely obliterated any sort of standards that a small golf-cart should adhere to while he was behind the wheel. He turned viciously and never let his foot an inch off of the ground, but kept himself planted with his overall muscular build. Though during a few close calls he would should out a victorious "Whoo!!", which would again be repeated as he slowly approached the ground level of their school.

"So how waz'zat?!" Vayne barked wildly as he slid out of the driver's side of the vehicle, "I swear we broke 80 in this thing, did you feel it?"

Ali didn't share nearly the same maniacal pleasure in being thrown about like a ragdoll while inside a vehicle going far beyond its manufacturing limits. The little quilava-based character slowly dripped out of her side of the cart and onto the cobblestone paved the island, winding up staring her school straight in the face by expected delivery time. Not that she really cared about school right just now. "WHAT IS WRONG WITH YOU!?" Ali shouted as she struggled to catch her stricken breath, "Y-You must be crazy! There's no way a sane person would drive like that!!" The poor thing was so flustered that her knees buckled as she tried to stand, "J-Just... thanks a lot, I-I'm glad I actually got here before it was over." Ali stated calmly as she wobbled unsoundly towards the front steps.

"Hey, no problem." Vayne said with a hint of apology in his voice, "I'm sorry if I scared you, but hey; at least I got you here when I said I did." he said with a big toothy grin before checking his watch, "Actually, a whole thirty seconds before!" He excitedly elevated his hand for a congratulatory palm slap, "High Five!"

Weakly, and choking down the better portion of whatever she had eaten last night, Ali concurred and slapped his hand before hobbling back towards the school. "Th-Thanks a lot... uh, Vayne was it?" she said flatly, "But I've really got to get to class, so..." Vayne's smile widened as he started up the steps with her, "Hey no problem, I've got class too!" he said excitedly, "Tell you what, since you're a freshman, I'll even get you to the auditorium." Ali grumbled audibly, already beginning to loath this lead-footed psychopath as he continuously attempted to force his company upon her. "Yeah, I don't think so." she said curtly, "See, I've got Freshman Orientation, and you look like... what, a senior?"

"Actually I'm a Junior, but thanks for the compliment." he said obliviously.

There was an unacknowledged staredown between them before Ali just finally grumbled and gave up. "Alright, come on... you freak..." she said dismissively as she started through the doorway, "You know how to get to the auditorium, right?"

***


Meanwhile, Freshman Orientation had still gone as according to schedule. It wasn't uncommon for a student to skip the admittedly boring procedure. All it really pertained of was rules, policies, and the general know-what of the school. More so than anything, the echo was unbearable. Why on earth the academy needed such a large sitting arrangement was beyond most of the faculty, though none of them could quite complain. Since last year, there had been several upgrades in the accommodations of one's posterior including seat warmers, soft fabric, and soft cushioning underneath it as opposed to the cold wooden seats of generations past. The decor was new, though kept the spirit of the place through a mural of several dragon-type pokemon all carved into the walls; namely the famous piece, 'Evolution of Dratini' done by Gespercho Smear Galle, worked into it on commission. Since it was by far the most esteemed center of learning standing in this world today, a little ostentatious was prescription.

Currently, an entire flock of freshmen bored out of their little minds sat in said cushy chairs as they half-heartedly listened to whoever might be on stage. A few were convincing, a few were lacking, and a few were just asleep. Even Don Tanner, from his section away from the children, had pulled up the armrests of a few seats and made himself a comfortable place to snooze while the 'Organizer of Events' did her job and kept these kids out of class. In front of him, a tall man in a burgundy suit with several ponytails rolled his eyes and grumbled about incompetence.

The only one taking this thing seriously was the aforementioned Organizer, a Snivy moemon who stood proudly on stage with her nose high in the air and her personal caretaker beside her as she delivered her expectations of this year to her uncaring classmates. Check that, not the school's expectations, hers. This girl had been to every prepping program offered back in Unova, so it was no surprise that she was the most qualified to act as Ninth Grade President without so much as an election. Looking at it now, most students would definitely have chosen otherwise. She stood on stage, all dolled up in her best yellow skirt and green blouse, and blew the short green hair from her eyes as she continued. "Excuse me," she laughed (no one esle did), "Hair issue, anyway, as I was saying; this class has a lot of potential, I know that I can drive the best out of you young boys and girls!" Even next to her, the tall dark woman in maid's garb couldn't help but roll her eyes underneath half-closed lids. Her chocolate skin turned a bright red around her cheeks as she saw more and more students questioning her presence on stage.

"So, when you graduate, you'll be able to look back and say "She helped me do that. Lilian did that." and you'll have me to thank, Lilian Lillygrass!"

She raised her arms for applause, though none really seemed to come...

"A-Anyway, I'll turn the microphone back over to-

Suddenly the auditorium's doors swung open, revealing Ali's slender shape for all to see. Unfortunately subtlety was not in her move list, Ali's sharp opening of the doors echoed throughout the entire auditorium, much to her embarrassment and the infuriated expense of Lilian, whose speech had now gone interrupted. "Ahem, excuse me!" she hollered into the microphone in an attempt to calm the quickly unsettling crowd, "Excuse me!!"

Below her, the man in burgundy couldn't help but crack a smile, "How embarrassing." he said in a gruff voice, "But, even if, it managed to shut that little tramp up." he smirked, "I guess I owe that little freshman something." To his shock, a pair of lanky arms draped themselves over his shoulders and a heavy weight landed on his head. "You really should take a chill pill, Sunshine." Don Tanner's lax tone sounded from above him. His head, soundly propped upon Mr. Sunny's, yawned as he kept his dead-weight status, "But'chea, I'm pretty glad little miss Nose-Face finally let someone else get a word in."

"Well!" Lilian huffed after getting the crowd's (lack of) attention, "I certainly hope this has all be entertaining for you, and I'll be returning the microphone to our Vice-Principal, Mr. Sunny!" the little girl, once stepping down from the podium, was revealed to be quite short. Even shorter than Ali! She looked a lot like a grass fairy with that green hair of hers. "Come on Suzu." she huffed, snapping her fingers at her maid... who apparently floated. "Well now, that was... enlightening." Sunny said sharply into the microphone, "How about we give Ms. Lillygrass a hand?"

No response...

"Yeah... I don't blame you."

Lots of laughter.

"Anyway, one last thing; we've recently adopted a student service policy, which would be those vending machines located on these areas of the schools; outside of bathrooms, the gym...

Ali sunk into her chair humiliated. "Craaaaaaaaap..." she whined to herself, "Now I wish I had skipped the rest of this class period." she groaned, noticing the evil eyes that Lilian was shooting her from across the auditorium. Apparently, she had already made a friend. Great. This school year was not turning out anything like she had hoped for...
1211.title: Green Gabbing and Little Red Racing

choices: Meeting Ali's Partner - Ember
12112.content:
Almost as soon as the Freshman Orientation was over with, the freshmen flooded out of the auditorium. Unfortunately, it was still the first day of classes, therefore they all still had their first class to attend to this day.

And even more unfortunately, that included Ali herself who had managed to step out of the way of the onslaught of other freshmen to look at her schedule (one of the few things she managed to grab before she rushed out of her room this morning). “Alright… Let’s see, according to this, I have to go to Special Moves Class with Professor... Locke? That’s a weird name, I wonder what kind of Moemon he is.”

As Ali was wondering what sort of weird character she’d bump into next (Vayne certainly made an impression on the young Quilava Moemon – not the kind that he would’ve enjoyed, but still, an impression), a slightly loud growl echoed from the small Moemon, making her face turn a bright red to match her outfit and auburn hair. ‘Damn it, I skipped out on breakfast and I almost lost whatever I ate last night thanks to that crazy speed demon.’

Rubbing her flat stomach, Ali looked around and saw a large vending machine (one of the many that Mr. Sunny himself had spoken about) standing only a few feet away from her – But it wasn’t like any kind of vending machine she’d seen back when she was at home. Still, the growls coming from her stomach were snarling for her to quell her hunger’s anger – So much so that she’d settle for anything to eat, even if it was chocolate coated or filled with cheese.

It may be unhealthy, but still, it’s better than skipping out on a meal. So quickly walking towards the large machine, Ali looked at the variety of foods and drinks that were lined up inside the machine. “Chips, fruit cups, cola… Is that ramen? Man, talk about choices.”

After a few moments of looking over the choices, Ali quickly slipped in a few coins that she had scrounged up in her pocket (Thank goodness she didn’t empty her pockets before she crashed last night) and quickly punched in a few buttons, making the machine hum to life. And with a soft thud, Ali quickly reached into the compartment at the bottom of the machine and pulled out a small four pack of powdered donuts.

As Ali ripped into the donuts’ plastic package, she told herself in her mind, ‘I’ll need all the sugar I can get today, maybe they’ll help me get through the day… Besides, donuts are still considered a breakfast food… Right?’

With that reassurance in her head, Ali began to walk down the hallway – Munching on one of the donuts as she took her steps. However, when she managed to get a distance away from the machine, Ali was unaware of a certain Snivy Moemon and her Frosslass maid were watching her as she walked away.

“Suzu,” Lilian growled with her hand under her chin.

“Yes, mi’lady?” the Frosslass maid asked with a slight bow, although, she sounded rather tired when she spoke.

“I want information on that insolent girl by the time of lunch,” Lilian requested as her eyes traveled to the Vending Machine next to her.

“Yes, mi’lady,” Suzu yawned to herself.

Suzu knew where this was going, her young mistress may have had a so called ‘noble’ attitude, but she had a short temper. Said short temper never ended well for the lady and for whoever was on the receiving end of the anger – as Suzu had seen before. But, who was she to prevent her mistress from making many mistakes?

“Also, Suzu, could you hand me some money?” Lilian requested as she licked her lips at the juice in the vending machine.

“Of course, mi’lady.”

TTTTTTT


It didn’t take long for Ali to find her classroom, and in all honesty, she expected there to be another freak like Vayne getting in her way. But she was glad she didn’t, it gave her a chance to polish off three of the four donuts she had gotten from the vending machine, ‘Hmm, these donuts are actually quite tasty – I think they’re from Swinub Sweets! They always make tasty foods.’

While Ali entered the room, she was surprised to see that she was in a room that only had one desk in it, which meant that the students were either sitting on the ground or standing alongside the walls. Other than that, it was a large room (almost like a gymnasium) that had some large windows and slightly padded walls and floors.

With a shrug, Ali walked towards some of the clearer parts of the room, still chewing on the donut she had in her mouth. When she got to a good place, Ali sat down on the ground, making sure her skirt was under her butt. ‘Still, I wonder what kind of class this is, and what kind of professor we’ve got here…’

Ali swallowed the donut and quickly pulled out the last from the emptied package and quickly tossed it into her mouth, immediately chewing and swallowing the sugary food.

As she chewed on the last of her makeshift breakfast, the sound of rolling wheels filled the air, making all the students in the room look towards the door. It didn’t take long to see the source of the noise, for almost a few moments later, a black and gray blur sped towards the door and immediately fell to the ground with a loud thud. “Urk! Well, that could’ve gone better…”

The figure that sped into the room immediately stood up, revealing to all of the students a tall and sleek man with really dark skin, long spiky black hair wearing a long gray scientist coat with a light purple sweater and black slacks underneath. The man had a pair of glasses over his surprisingly sharp and red eyes, which took a lot of students back when he looked at them. Behind the Gengar moemon’s body was a fancy red and black office chair that had fallen when its wheels collided with the door frame, obviously sending the weird Gengar Moemon to the ground.

After dusting off his scientist coat, the weird Gengar quickly picked up the chair and began to walk out of the room. “Let me try that again…”

Almost all of the students in the room sweatdropped as the Gengar stepped out of the room… And those beads of sweat grew larger as the professor actually tried to speed into the room with the office chair, only to fail in the same manner as before! “URK! Okay… We’ll do this later.”

Picking himself and the office chair up, the Gengar slowly walked to the desk, yawning loudly as he set himself up at the desk. “Alright, welcome to your first class at Gijinka Academy. I’m your first teacher, but I prefer to be called Professor Locke.”

‘Yep, its official, this school is filled with freaks,’ Ali thought to herself as she sighed slightly, remembering Vayne, then that Snivy moemon – Lilian, and this guy to top off the list.

“Now then, before we get to discussing to class today,” Locke continued, placing his elbows on the desk in front of him. “I want to point out a few things about the academy itself… Gijinka academy is a school designed for Moemon who wish to bring out their potential – This means that this school will teach you all how to fight with your natural abilities. Now, that isn’t to say that you have to compete in the pro leagues necessarily, in fact, only a handful of graduating students become a part of the battling league.

“We do teach the regular high school curriculum so that you can even go off to get regular jobs or even continue your education at a college. Most of the time, these classes here act as self-defense classes, while at the same time refining you all into model citizens.”

With a loud yawn, Locke twisted his head slightly, “Alright, now that we’ve gotten that boring crap out of the way, time for my class’s introduction.”

A lot of students stepped back from Locke’s bluntness.

Lifting his hand up, Locke smirked to himself as a dark aura appeared over his arm, “Now, this class itself teaches you all how to tap into your natural abilities and even use that as a powerful ability or attack. Watch, I’m of the Gengar family, known for their ghostly characteristics…”

It was then that Locke plunged his hand into the desk, his hand literally phasing through the wood and making some of the students jump backwards. “Now, this technique is only for ghost type Moemon, so unfortunately, I can’t promise that you’ll all learn how to do this, but still, I’ll teach you how to access your own Moemon traits and control them.”

Pulling his hand from the desk, Locke also pulled out what appeared to be a large clipboard, “Now, continuing, since it’s the first day, I won’t be expecting a lot from you all, so today, I’ll be assigning partners that you’ll have for the first half of the semester. Your partner should share at least one of your ‘attributes’, and you’ll be acting as study partners. Eventually, once we reach the second half, I’ll be assigning an upperclassman to your partner listing, so you can learn from a more experienced student. Now, we’ll start with the Fighting-types, since there are so few of you listed for this class. When I call your names, raise your hands so you can find your partners. And when I’m done, I want you all to spend the rest of the class period getting to know your partner.

“First off, Wright Steelhart…”

(had to continue on the next chapter du te to word count. GAH!"
12112.title: Foreshadowing - Both BIG and Slim

choices: In order to get to know each other, Ember takes Ali to the cafeteria
Another team approaches Ali and Ember (good? bad? your choice)
121121.content:
(Gah, continuing from the last chapter, stupid 10,000 word count!!!! >.<)

Pulling his hand from the desk, Locke also pulled out what appeared to be a large clipboard, “Now, continuing, since it’s the first day, I won’t be expecting a lot from you all, so today, I’ll be assigning partners that you’ll have for the first half of the semester. Your partner should share at least one of your ‘attributes’, and you’ll be acting as study partners. Eventually, once we reach the second half, I’ll be assigning an upperclassman to your partner listing, so you can learn from a more experienced student. Now, we’ll start with the Fighting-types, since there are so few of you listed for this class. When I call your names, raise your hands so you can find your partners. And when I’m done, I want you all to spend the rest of the class period getting to know your partner.

“First off, Wright Steelhart…”

Ali began to doze off as Professor Locke began to pair off names, and was almost to the point of falling asleep…

“Alison Reaves.”

Ali’s eyes shot open, making her jump up and quickly lift her hand up into the air. “Good, your partner’s Ember Sinclair.”

Looking around, Ali saw her partner bouncing towards her, literally! Ali stepped back at the sight of the large ball of what was going to be her future partner in this class. The girl Ember in question was a rotund girl with tanned skin, large innocent blue eyes and long curly crimson hair that reached past her shoulders. The girl was dressed in a long black skirt that flowed just above her chunky knees (and from what Ali could see from the faces of the male students that the short vulpix girl skipped past, the hams called her backside were probably barely covered by the expansive cloth), a white shirt that struggled to confine the twin large melons that Ember was smuggling along with that large belly, and to top things off, she had a pink vest that didn’t seem to serve much of a purpose other than for decoration.

The Vulpix girl stopped right in front of Ali, almost smacking into the small Quilava Moemon – And it was at this point that Ali realized that she and Ember were almost the same height to boot! Ember smiled brightly on her cute cherubic face. “Heya! Ali, right? Let’s get along greatly!”

Ali shook her head, trying to get her mind from wondering if Ember’s breasts were bigger than Fontina’s, and lifted up her hand to the chucky Vulpix. “Uh, yeah, sure…”

Ember took Ali’s hand, but much to Ali’s surprise, Ember pulled the Quilava girl towards her and put her in a deep hug, almost smothering Ali into her monstrous breasts. “Ah! There’s no need to be so stiff! We’ll be the best of BFFs!”

While Ali was starting to suffocate, Professor Locke was just continuing his name call off, so a majority of the class didn’t pay attention to the Quilava girl’s plight.
121121.title: Enter Ember

choices: Okay, battle commence.
1211212.content:
As Ali slowly suffocated beneath Ember's mighty folds, the class continued to go about the presumed schedule. Some were excited about meeting their new partners, some weren't. All were quiet. Professor Locke was a very intimidating man, and he didn't look like the kind of guy who enjoyed repeating himself. Even Ali, not that she had much choice, dare not holler out that her new partner was trying to kill her out of fear of the ghost type moemon leading this seminar. "I'll be conducting preliminary exams to get a feel on how far along you and your partner are in regards to your natural abilities." Professor Locke said rather lifelessly, "This way I'll be better able to instruct you, because frankly I just don't expect that much from any of you."

At that, Ember turned (apparently either choosing to ignore, or completely oblivious to the second condescending half of that sentence) looked at Ali with the most excited gleam in her eyes. "Yay!!" she squealed, "I get to show Professor Locke just how good I am with my fireballs!!"

In her excitement, Ember's grip grew tighter and tighter around Ali's spinal cord. The poor little Quilava moemon could absolutely feel the vice-like wrap this doughball had around her; her only complaint and thought to complain about was "if I just had some damn breasts I'd at least have some room to breath." However Ember eventually released her pint-sized partner from her death lock, not because she sensed the immediate danger that she had placed her new BFF in but only so that she could shoot up one monstrously thick arm and wave it around like a lunatic. "Oooh!" she called excitedly from the seats, "Mr. Locke, can me and Ali go first?!"

Ali took a deep raspy inhale the very second she was released, dramatically throwing her head back as she whipped away from Ember's suffocatingly fat arms. It didn't even occur to her that Ember had said anything at all until she had a clear head, her response being an immediate and sharp; "Wait, what?"

Much to the shock of everybody, much less Ali, the addressed professor's response was a simple: "Mmmm... okay." with a relatively amusing influx. Ember stood up and started jumping around, clapping her hands throwing out 'yay's like confetti, and while the rest of the class watched with relative disgust at how the big butterball jiggled, Ali could only parrot her earlier response. "What?" Locke said dismissively, "We were going to go in alphabetical order anyway, and you're the first one on the list Alison Reaves." he emphasized her name teasingly. "Alright, I'll take these two and... um... you two..." Locke pointed vaguely into the crowd of students as he rushed the two fire-types out of the gymnasium and into the hallway.

Much to the confusion of everyone else left standing aimlessly in the hallway, someone finally piped up: "Who, um, who did he mean by you two?"

***


"Alright now."

Locke seemed to have taken a breath of fresh air; his demeanor had changed slightly. Still really scary, but now there was a sense of new life about him. His eyebrows were no longer furrowed to the point of wrinkling and his gaze more relaxed. Frighteningly enough, a small grin worked its way onto his dark face; scaring the crap out of Ali. She wouldn't dare say this out loud, but Professor Locke really had a pedo's smile! "Now that I've got you two out here"-again, really not a good thing to say with your pedo smile on-"We're going to see just how well you can already control your natural element... in your case, how well the pyrocentric abilities have progressed inside of you."

With one arm spread out, he gestured towards the dead end of the hall, "This hallway is flame retardant, has an inside layer of rubber, and was painted with oil-based paint on top of being structurally perfect." he almost sounded like he was bragging, but Ali knew just what was to come next. And it was something she'd been waiting to hear since she enrolled in this stupid school, "You can be as rough as you want."

A devious smile crossed Ali's lips as she got the itch to let loose. "However I should warn you, anything you singe, melt, or otherwise destroy will be cleaned up after class. By you. So don't go too crazy." he said rather warmly. "Do we have a sparring team yet?" he asked, peeking at the doors behind the two of them in search of another pair of students; casting the two of them aside so he could (literally) pop his head in. "Hey, I asked for two students!" Ali could hear his muffled voice even through the heavy wooden doors. Seriously, the way he did that so easily... well, at all was just too creepy!

"They'll be out in a sec."

"Professor Locke?" Ember asked innocently as her hand rose and commenced its ritual flailing around, "How come we're in the hallway when all the fighting stuff is in the classroom?". Her answer was met with a blank stare and pursed lips, the look lasting for a good five seconds before being completely ignored altogether. "Ah, here they are." he said flatly as he ushered in a short girl with vibrant citrus hair. Wait. What?

"Oh, its the oversleeper-slash-underachiever." came the haughty tone of one recognizable freshman prez. Those ridiculous green locks of hers made her pretty easy to spot, "And she's partnered with the... well, just plain over-eater, how fitting!" she laughed at that. It was really an abrasive laugh too, and the way she tilted her nose back as she gafawwed... It made Ali want to just rip it right off! "Yeah, thats me." Ali said flatly, "So I guess its just you versus me and Ember here since no one can stand to be around you." Lilian scoffed, tilting her head back and to the left as she did so. "You wish. I have my own personal partner."

At once, much like the professor had before, the woman that Ali recognized from Lilian's speech phased through the doors and took her place at Lilian's side. Ali took one glance at her and shot back to the professor, "There's no way she's a freshman!" she barked, eye twitching slightly, "Look at that rack, that girl's got to at least be a junior!!"

And of course, Ali was completely right. No freshman had a bust quite like this girl's. For starters, she was dark-skinned like the professor; a common attribute amongst ghost-types. Her tail of her long black hair reached down to her backside. while it split above the shoulders into braids that reached the exact middle of her waist when standing. Atop her head was a sort of veil. Her face, solemn yet beautiful, sported relatively dainty, doll-like features including the most piercing pair of blue eyes Ali had ever seen. She was dressed in a traditional Unova maid's outfit and, as mentioned above, her boobs were huge.

"Why would I want to pair up with some freshman when I have a perfectly good Suzu standing right next to me?" Lilian asked haughtily, "She graduated here a long time ago, so I know she's the best choice! Aha-ha-ha!"

"Professor Locke!!" Ali cried, "How can you let her do this?!"

From behind his glasses, Ali saw the blank stare of her mentor. One that spoke truth. The kind of truth that only a trusted older gentleman could so easily speak of. In one word, he revealed to Ali just how the world worked outside of high school, and she would be wise to never forget his lessons...

"Cash bribe." he said, whipping out a fat wad of bills, "Okay, battle commence."
1211212.title: Bad. Because its my choice.

choices: Lilian and Suzu (mostly Suzu), after all experience counts...
Ali and Ember! Type advantage! And to celebrate... LUNCH!
12112121.content:
Ali was dumbstruck at the sight of the brash, and blatant bribery that her first (albeit creepy) professor at this academy so proudly displayed. From the creepy red eyed look in Professor Locke’s eyes, Ali could tell that the Gengar professor didn’t seem to really care that he was setting one of the worst examples that a professor could ever do.

“Alrighty!” Ember cheered as she jumped up, surprising most of those who are hallway with the facts that she could jump so easily and so high, while at the same time surprised at the amount of bouncing that the girl’s bosom produced. “Let’s show’em what we’ve got, BFF!”

“Oh, how cute,” Lilian laughed slightly as she took a few steps back behind the busty Frosslass maid. “The bigger of you two seems to think you can win… And you’re BFFs? That’s just hilarious.”

“Big talk from an ironing board of a Snivy!” Ali snapped back, making Lilian’s laughter cease almost on a dime.

A large blood vessel began to pulse on the side of the slim Snivy Moemon’s head, her shoulders slumped slightly and her eyes narrowed down at the Quilava Moemon. “Humph! Like you can talk! You’re no better than a cutting board, you rude, sorry excuse for a Moemon!”

“C-Cutting board?!” Ali stuttered before she stomped her foot into the ground. “Better than being a snobby loudmouth who survives by listening to herself!”

“HOW DARE YOU!”

Insults, left and right, began to shoot off from both sides of the hallway, those who weren’t involved couldn’t help but blink a few times in confusion at the battle of insults. However, out of the three who weren’t include in the childish battle…

“WOWZA! This must be trash talking!” Ember squealed with stars in her eyes, watching as the two slim girls kept slinging insults at each other (for some reason, they both kept bringing out the fact that they both had a flat chest, but Ember put that fact out of her head). “Ooh! Ooh! Can I be apart of this Professor Locke!?!?”

Having fallen partially asleep on his feet, the Gengar snapped himself away and shook his head. “Actually, I’d prefer if we could get on with the real battle… But since these two aren’t likely to do that without a third party interference…”

Holding his hand up to his face, Locke’s face began to curl up into a malicious smirk that seemed to almost fly off of his face, forming into a ghastly smirk that immediately screeched out loudly, making both Ali and Lilian cease their squabbling as well as making Ember’s joy quickly disappear. The only one who didn’t seem affected was Suzu, who had her eyes closed the entire affair.

“Scary Face,” Locke snickered with his regular face returning (albeit it was still creepy and sent shivers down all three of the younger girls’ spines). “I should’ve done that in the beginning. Now, either you fight each other right now, or perhaps, you’d like to fight against me? I wouldn’t mind tussling with a few young girls.”

‘He didn’t even try to hide it that time,’ Ali thought with a shake of her head as she clapped her hands together, creating a pair of circular flames around her hands. “Fine, if that’s how you wanna do this, then I’ll show you what I can do with my Flame Wheel!”

“Ooh!” Ember added as she lifted her arms up, creating several small blue flames that danced around her large, bulbous body. “Will’o Wisp! Will’o Wisp!”

“Suzu!” Lilian sighed with a snap of her fingers, making the dark skinned, busty maid strike a dramatic pose with the wind around her arms starting to freeze, as evidenced by the ice crystals that were forming around her form. “Teach them a lesson!”

“Yes milady,” Suzu sighed before she dashed towards the two fire type freshmen girls.

The battle was long and hard, even if it was with a type advantage and two against one, but things began to look brighter at the end and the winner was…
12112121.title: Fire and Ice! ... And Grass too, I guess...

choices: Ember and Ali get sent to the nurse, and released about lunchtime
121121211.content:
The fight began with Ali rushing into battle head first with Suzu.

The dwarvish Quilava girl's instincts told her that, despite the significant difference in age and ability, her pyro powers would be enough to melt away Suzu's cryokinesis. Instinct would prove wrong, as the older woman dodged her hearty charge with relative ease; taking it upon herself to begin floating in midair to further enhance the small girl's chase. Already things were looking pretty glum; a fact that would be recognized and dealt with by a low growl coming from Ali. She turned on her heels to face the levitating lady in black and roused her flames higher up on her body. Positioning one arm as outstretched, open palm, and facing towards Suzu, she conjured up a relatively strong Ember that was sent soaring towards the ice mistress.

She floated downwards to just barely miss the surprisingly proficient burst of flames, escaping them without being scorched in the slightest. Using her own levitating ice crystals, Suzu effortlessly sent an Ice Shard attack hurdling at the young moemon. A hit on the right leg, Ali winced as she fought herself to stay on foot. Regardless of encroaching frostbite, Ali fired up another Ember attack at her opponent; another miss, but it got her much lower to the ground.

Taking matters into her own hands, Ember's big brown eyes sparkled with a mischievous glee. The blubberball took a few steps back and began charging towards her still levitating challenger. Not exactly the brightest move. "Body Slam!" she shouted aloud, jumping up surprisingly high into the air and falling reminiscent of a meteor to the Earth's surface. However, due to a type mismatch, Ember's skills went unnoticed and unappreciated as Suzu effortlessly phased through the belly flop. "Ooh..." Ember moaned, "that hurt my tummy."

Taking flight once more, Suzu rose higher and higher above the tagteam, her own partner, and the ever-observant Professor Locke; raising her arms to a perfect 180 degree angle and opening her palms, she gave a single command: "Hail". At once the hallway's ceiling was lost amongst thick, dark clouds of noir, small flakelets of snow falling from above quickly becoming chunks of ice. Undaunted, Ali continued her pyrocentric attacks in hopes of subduing Suzu with proper type matchups. She cast fireball after fireball at Suzu's mysterious form, but to no avail. Out of seven casts, only one hit!

"Ember!" Ali shouted out to her partner over the heavy icefall, "You got any ideas?"

"Get her on the ground!!" Ember shouted back, cupping her pudgy hands around her mouth.

Nodding, Ali decided to prepare herself for the worst. The only thing Ali had in her disposal that could get her up to that altitude was Flame Wheel, and that was quite a long shot given Suzu's evasiveness. But, never the less, it was worth a try! Ali fed the fires that floated around her hands, letting it encroach upon her back. Slowly, it spread as she curled over and readied herself for a roll. She jumped, and ignited the mystical flames that covered her so that they may propel her through the air. Success! She was now hurdling towards Suzu!

As a physical attack, Suzu could very well have easily phased through it to avoid damage. But due to her secondary type, ice, she was at a loss for that ability. Fire weakened her, and it was pretty obvious by her moveset. She had no choice but to physically avoid the hit, lowering herself down significantly until she was just a hair's length above the floor. As Ali rebounded off of the wall, she uncurled and shouted to her partner, "Do whatever you've got to do now!"

Ember smiled, dimpling her chubby cheeks, as she too curled herself up. Surprisingly enough, she was quite dexterous for a girl of her overall girth; enough so to sit down and wrap her arms around her knees. Using the properties of a rock-type moveset, Ember began to roll faster and faster in place before releasing herself to Suzu's back. A minor hit, but damage still. Ali decided to run defense and keep Suzu vulnerable with continued fireworks. She slung embers wildly at the ghostly woman in hopes that she wouldn't have the chance to block Ember's rebound.

Unfortunately, all that did was get her mad.

Seeming somewhat exasperated at her continued abuse, Suzu stopped Ember dead in her tracks with Mist. The overfed lummox hit the wall without even knowing what was happening! With her evasiveness raised, Suzu could operate in secrecy. A quick ice shard towards Ali was enough to get her riled up, the girl fired blindly into the thick mist while getting pummeled with hail. However, she missed every single time. Ember, desperately trying to assist her BFF, found herself lighting the way with will'o'wisps in hopes of leaving Suzu with a burn; but again, they came up dry.

The battle came to an end in one mighty move; Suzu decided to whip up Sheer Cold to freeze her opponents. Nearly to death.

And it might have been, at the worst, a very serious coma. But after some reprimanding on Professor Locke's part, the two girls were revived with a handy pair of Revives from the Professor's pocket.

"Ugh..." Ali and Ember groaned simultaneously after jolting up. "Congratulations, you lost." Lilian said haughtily as she let her head fall back and let loose another heinous bout of laughter. "I don't know what you're so... proud about." Ali struggled to make words, finding this near-death experience very hard on her, "You didn't even fight..." Her knitpicking fell on deaf ears, of course, as Lilian chose to ignore the cries of her flat-chested rival. "Suzu really showed you a thing or two, why would I bother stepping in on an obviously perfect lesson in humility?"

Ali tried to jump up, but found her body far too weak to do so effectively. She instead just fell back down to the floor with a serious headache.

High School sucks.
121121211.title: A Serious Case of the Shivers

choices: Ali digs in while Vayne explains...
Ember wakes up to the smell of food, Vayne takes both girls to the cafeteria
1211212111.content:
Lilian laughed loudly at her (Suzu’s) victory as she looked down upon the quickly revived Ali and Ember, “Oh hohohoho! I hope that this teaches you a valuable lesson you two lousy…”

WHAP!

Lilian yelped when a clipboard gently bonked her on the forehead, eliciting a small snicker from Suzu. The clipboard was still held in Professor Locke’s hand as he casually looked down at the weakened fire-type duo, “Alright, that’s enough.”

“Professor Locke, what do you think you are doing!?!” Lilian snarled as she stomped her foot into the ground a few times.

“My job,” Locke answered quickly with his red eyes narrowing down on the snobby Snivy Moemon in front of him. “You may have paid me to pair you up with these two, but as a teacher I can’t let you harm the students past a certain extent.”

‘He says this after we get out tails handed to us,’ Ali thought to herself before she closed her eyes, trying to subdue the headache that was rasping around in her head. It was getting too much that Ali began to slip out of consciousness…

TTTT- Some Time Later…-TTTTT


“Where… Where am I?”

That was a good question that Ali had asked herself, cause from where she was standing, it looked as though she was standing in nothing more than a huge mess of nothing but white. White as far as the eye could see… Ali could almost compare it to the snow storms that she saw whenever she tagged along to the school winter trip.

The only difference was that there seemed to be no light, no darkness, nothing.

Ali took a few steps, her footsteps echoing through the spacious area. “Well this sucks… What the hell happened?”

“Isn’t it obvious? You failed!”

Ali turned around, the voice she just heard was so familiar, heck it was a voice she heard several times. And as she turned around, her suspicions were confirmed – It was none other than that snobby Snivy herself, Lilian who was behind Ali. Only there was one big difference, and by big, it was BIG! Lilian’s was practically towering over the smaller Quilava Moemon, standing at least a good twenty feet taller than her, almost as if Lilian was a giant Snivy Moemon. “Are you so hopeless that you can’t see how bad of a drop out you are? Ha!”

“D-Drop out?!” Ali snapped, her eyes narrowing at the enlarged Snivy. However, while her face and tone of voice showcased rage and anger, the rest of Ali’s body was shivering slightly. She knew it wasn’t out of fear, so once again, Ali spun around to see what the cause was.

Unfortunately, as she turned around, she found herself mashed up against something incredibly large and soft, but extremely cold at the same time when Ali’s body touched up against it. When Ali pushed herself away from the large object, she immediately saw what she was touching and her face went as red as Ember’s hair. In front of her was an extremely gigantic Suzu, but somehow, Ali was standing right in front of her massive bust – Both tits seemed to be bigger than Ali’s whole body!

Ali staggered backwards once again, this time tripping over the backs of her feet and sending her bouncing on her tiny tush. It was then that she noticed a large shadow looming overhead and saw that the gigantic Lilian was looming over her (and thanks to that, Ali was given a not so welcomed view of the Snivy Girl’s lime green panties). The large Snivy Moemon scowled down at Ali and slowly lifted her foot up into the air, “Trash like you doesn’t belong in this world!”

And that’s when Lilian dropped her foot on top of Ali’s body…

TTTTTTTT


“AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAHHHHH!”

Ali shot up in the bed that she was laying in, her forehead covered in a cold sweat that dripped over her entire body. Her breathing was forced and she slowly clutched her arms tightly, trying to calm herself down from the odd dream she had just experienced…

“Ah, you’re awake, good,” A calm, loving voice stated, making Ali lift her head up to see the owner of that voice.

Standing at the foot of Ali’s bed was a large, and chubby woman dressed in a long white lab coat that covered her busty and bubbly frame. She had a chubby if not cute face that was surrounded with long chestnut colored hair (although the top part seemed to be darker). Under her coat was a regular tan T-Shirt with a black skirt that struggled to contain this woman’s chubby hourglass frame. If Ali had to guess about what this woman was, she would probably put her money on a Kangaskhan Moemon, she certainly had the figure as such a Moemon. Ali blinked a few times as the young woman in front of her walked up to her and placed a hand atop of Ali’s forehead. “Hmm… Good, you appear to broken that fever you had when you came in…”

“F-Fever?” Ali questioned with her head tilted to the side.

“Yes, you were practically chilled to the bone, dear,” The bubbly Moemon in front of her stated as she placed her hand under her chin. “When you and your friend were brought in, you both were burning up. I’ve only seen this with seniors when they use attacks like blizzard or such… But freshmen? I’m going to have to speak to headmaster Tanner about this…”

Ali had so many questions that she wanted to ask this Kangaskhan moemon… But the only question that came to mind was, “W-Who are you?”

“Hmm?” The Kangaskhan Moemon mused as she smiled warmly at Ali. “Oh dear, that’s right, you’re a freshman, well, I’m the nurse and Home Ec professor here – Shera Strongarm, but please, call me Shera, everyone else does.”

Nurse?

Well that would explain the bed that Ali was in. Slowly, the Quilava Moemon turned her head around the room, seeing all of the regular stuff a person would see in a school nurse’s office – Medicine, charts, a curtain around the bed areas, a desk with donuts on it (although, Ali was sure that those weren’t standard in a nurse’s office), and there was another bed next to Ali’s…

And that’s where Ember was snoozing currently, her whole body looking like a huge ball of tan colored dough – It was a wonder to Ali how Ember could sleep sitting up, but then again, if she had sweater puppies as big as Ember’s, she’d probably be able to sleep on those things as well.

“Anyway, dear, you should be okay,” Shera stated as she smiled down at Ali. “But I need you to promise not to take on any upper classmen, even if you have a type advantage, you need to take into account the difference in levels…”

‘I was the one who picked the fight?!’ Ali thought with a dull look on her face. ‘Why do I think that snob is behind that as well?’

“Miss… Ali Reaves, right?” Shera questioned, immediately getting her answer from Ali with a quick nod. “Good, I’d like you to stay for a little bit longer, at least until your friend wakes up and your other one gets back here.”

Now that just confused Ali, maybe Ember considered Ali her ‘BFF’ but Ali barely knew the girl! And who was this other friend? Could it have been Fontina? She was practically the only other person she knew close enough to consider a friend… And you could include Midnight, but that was using the worst concept of ‘friend’ to describe her…

That’s when the door opened up, catching both Ali’s and Shera’s attention, and almost immediately, Ali’s eyes widened when she saw who was standing in the doorway.

“Good AFTERNOON, Nurse Shera!” a familiar muscular Arcanine laughed as he stepped into the room, a large bag slung over his shoulder. “I hope you took good care of the two guests in here, giving them your trademarked bedside manner!”

“I always give my best Vayne,” Shera giggled back in reply as Ali’s jaw dropped slightly. “And you’ll be happy to know that your friend here finally woke up.”

“Excellent!” Vayne laughed as he trotted over to Ali’s bed. “When that old coot Locke called me to drag a couple of freshman to the nurse’s office, I was a little surprised to see this little freshman amongst the two.”

Ali was about to say something, but that’s when a slightly loud rumbling sound echoed through the air, at first, Ali’s eyes traveled over to Ember… But saw that the bulbous Vulpix Moemon was still sleeping, albeit she was licking her lips, but still asleep. That’s when a second growl echoed through the air, and it was Ali’s face that turned red when she realized it was her stomach.

Shera smiled brightly as Vayne laughed loudly, the athletic Arcanine Moemon walked up to Ali’s bed and placed the bag carefully on the bed. “I had a feeling you’d be hungry, so I got you a few things from the cafeteria… I didn’t know what you liked, but here ya go!”

Alright, Ali had some questions, and it was obvious that Vayne and Shera had the answers… But then again, that smell emanating from the bag was taking the side of her growling stomach.
1211212111.title: Nightmares and Nurses

choices: Ember's hookup in the cafeteria gets Ali all the best grub! For next to nothing!
Vayne's schedule for lunch is patrolling the campus for "evil"... great.
12112121112.content:
The aroma of Vayne's mysterious parcel seemed to slowly fill the crowded office like warm water. As she sat, slowly losing herself to the potato sack'd siren, its aura flooded outwards and touched a little bit of everything in its conquest of Ali's nostrils. The smell of cotton balls and band-aids usually stereotypical of such a facility as this, was over-run by sweet smellings of meat, many juices blending together in the great conqueror that was odor to make a mouthwateringly tantalizing smell that would drive even the most dedicated of vegans into a voracious carnivorous frenzy. The dainty nostrils of the Quilava girl flexed as they struggled to take in as much of the aroma as possible, chilled bones nursed back to warmth by the healing power of Vayne's package...

"A-Actually Vayne, that smells..." Ali paused so as to take another whiff, finding herself at a lack of words to describe the delicate harmony of meat, "Pretty damn good!"

"Great!" Vayne roared as he slammed the sack at the foot of the bed, "Because, since I had no idea what sort of meals you might fancy, I just took a bunch of mine and tossed them together!"

What happened next would destroy Ali's perfect paradismial thought bubbles.

Vayne, foolish as he often was, had thought it perfectly acceptable that none of the food he would be bringing the two fire-type patients be individually wrapped, contained, or cared for in any general matter. When he said "tossed them together" Vayne actually meant that he gathered up his favorite foods, put them in a sack as they were, and carried them to the nurses's office; actually expecting Ali to be okay with eating complete and total slop. As you can probably imagine, it was utterly disgusting. Several meat bones were visible in the large pile, cooked to absolute perfection and dripping with juices, most of which oozed into the mashed potatos that he hadn't cared to bowl or package. The bread, soggy with meat juices as well, was mostly cheesy due to the clearly under-cared for packets of queso. All of this sat atop a once clean bedsheet and at the foot of a deeply disturbed Quilava moemon.

"H-How can you..."

"Huh, it all looked fine when I put it in there..." Vayne said quizzically as he dipped a strong sturdy finger into the mashed potato goo, grabbed a dollop of the concoction and licked it off of his finger. Flashing an approving smile Ali's way, he gave a thumb's up and his seal of approval. "No worries, Citizen!" He said deeply, "The taste has only been altered minorly, your meal should still be quite enjoyable for you and your-

"I'M NOT EATING THIS CRAP!" Ali hollered as she drew the blanket closer to her with one hand and chucked a bowl previously containing mashed potatos (judging by the debris left inside) at Vayne's head. He was eerily unafflicted. "This is just... this is just nasty!" she continued on, "I mean really; how much of a brain-dead idiot do you have to be to eat something that looks like that?!"

As if a sign from Heaven Above, Ali's questions were answered in the form of a low rumble emenating from Ember's tummy. The slumbering girl next to her, adorably using her own humongo-boobs as headrests as she snuggled with her own corpulence, was shaken into a half-cognitive state at the pleasant smell of the ungodly mixture. "Mmm..." Ember moaned, beginning to kneed her tummy longingly as the smell made her chubby little legs kick, "Ember smells something yummy~!!" Cutely, the massive girl struggled into a seated position and let out an almost infantile yawn, stretching her impossibly thick arms out wide and plopping down to the floor with a heavy "BOOM!" beneath her.

At the sight of the massive pile-up of randomly placed foodstuffs on the bed next to her own, Ember's eyes widened as much as her chubby cheeks would allow them. Without saying a word, she simply giggled madly and skipped over; beginning to sample out the least-deformed parts. "Oh num num num!!" the nearly spherical Vulpix girl said, giddy as a schoolgirl, as she bit off a large chunk of meat. The Mashed Potatos were extra. And so Ali, Shera, and Vayne watched with a sort of morbid curiousity at the gluttonous little ball of caramel colored dough that ate such curious things. "Um... Ember?" Shera piped up at the feasting girl in front of her, "M-Maybe Vayne should escort you two to the cafeteria... its almost lunchtime, and-

"Lunchtime?!" Ember said, energy almost frighteningly psychopathic, "Oh boy oh boy oh boy!!" she squealed before grabbing Ali's hand and jerking her out of bed, "Lets go, BFF! Its First Day Meatloaf Day!"

"Aw, gross!" Ali hollered in the hallway, "At least wash your hands after touching that crap first!!"

There was a slightly awkward silence between the two well-acquainted veterans of the academy after the two fire-types left. "Vayne?" Shera asked calmly, neck cricking menacingly as she slowly turned towards the flamboyant Arcanine moemon. "Yes Nurse Shera Strongarm?" he answered dumbly. "Who was it who fixed you up after your first big fight with that Tyranitaur moemon your freshman year?"

"Why, you Nurse Shera."

"And who was it who patched you up good as new after your battle with that Recruiter from Swampert Tech?"

"...You did, but my memory is a little hazy due to all those medications..."

"Exactly." Shera said menacingly, palming the decorative ball at the end of the restbed and sending several fissures down its side, "So why do you pay me back by dumping food ALL OVER my CLEAN sheets?!"

...
...
...
"I suppose I shall go escort my friends to their luncheon."

"I think you should do that."
12112121112.title: Soiled it!

choices: Before Ali can sink her teeth into the berry - Blaire the head chef appears!
*CHOMP* Meh, not too bad of a taste...
121121211121.content:
Ali was a little torn at the moment.

On one hand, she was a bit disgusted by the slimy, food covered grip of the globular Vulpix Moemon that had her pudgy finger’s wrapped around Ali’s wrist. On the other hand, the Quilava Moemon was impressed with Ember, it was hard to believe that a girl with Ember’s… bountiful curves was able to move at such speeds or even move at all! Heck, the girl even knew how to use her weight (Ali was pretty sure that Vulpix Moemon couldn’t learn Roll Out, but she wasn’t an expert on Vulpix move lists), and was showcasing it by easily dragging Ali through the hallways at a decent pace almost as if the petite Quilava girl was nothing more than a rag doll.

In a sense, Ali could’ve been considered a little jealous of Ember – Heck, those melons she was smuggling under that tight shirt were already competing in the size competition with Fontina’s (and that icy bitch – Suzu’s), and she wouldn’t have minded having that strength and agility… Of course she wouldn’t want the rest of Ember, all that flab. ‘How much do you have to eat to get that big?! And considering how quick this girl moves, how has she not burned any of that flab off?!’

Unfortunately, Ali wouldn’t get the answer to those questions in her head for as the two were going through the hallways…

“Oi! Wait for me!”

Ember came to a quick stop, which made Ali go skidding directly into the two beanbags that were Ember’s behind and forced her from the vulpix’s surprisingly strong grip. Almost like she was being pushed back by rubber, Ali was flung backwards right into the person who had just called out to the two Freshmen Fire types which was none other than…

“My, my, my, miss, are you alright?” Vayne questioned as he gently caught Ali before she crashed into him. “You just seem to get into more and more trouble every time we cross paths!”

Ali yanked herself from Vayne, surprising the Arcanine Moemon, “Well, maybe it’s because your insanity keeps bringing me bad luck? What the heck are you doing here anyway?”

In response to Ali’s comments, Vayne just snickered with his arms crossed, “Hmm, maybe! Maybe! As to answer your question, Nurse Shera asked me to accompany you two to the cafeteria, after all, you’re both freshmen and I doubt that you two know where to find it.”

Damn, Ali had to give him that. The only cafeteria she knew was in the dorm she was in, and from what she could gather, she wouldn’t have enough time to get there and back before she had to get back to classes…

“Ember knows!” Ember announced, surprising both of the other Fire-Types. “In fact, I work in the cafeteria before school! So, I can get us there quick!”

Ali was actually thankful to know the portly Vulpix… At least until…

“Ooh! But you can come too, scruffy man!” Ember offered, holding a hand up to Vayne.

“Why thank you little miss!” Vayne laughed loudly.

It was at this moment that Ali knew that the chances of her having a normal social life while at this school were quickly disappearing…

TTTTTTT


Not even five minutes passed when the three fire types arrived in the kitchen – The very kitchen of the school, with all the brush steel, the lovely mixture of aromas, and even the large looming shadows that a student could want. Although, this did bring up a question or two…

“Why are we in here?” Ali asked bluntly as she pulled her hand away from Ember’s.

Ember released her hand on Vayne (who took a moment to rub his sore hand slightly) and smiled brightly at both Ali and Vayne, “My boss wanted me to have lunch with her today! She’s having a couple of her sisters for lunch too and said that I should bring some friends with me to lunch.”

“Ah, what an honor young miss!” Vayne laughed loudly again.

However, Ali didn’t have the same sentiments as the Arcanine Moemon had, she was still a little sore (both metaphorically and physically) from the loss at the hands of that snobby Snivy – Lilian and her overly chest-inflated maid – Suzu.

Of course, Ali’s thoughts were once again interrupted when Ember appeared in front of her with a small box that was filled with blue colored berries (that seemed to have a waxy scent to them). “What the?”

“Here!” Ember gleefully offered as she placed a berry in Ali’s hands and began to walk over to Vayne. “While we wait for Miss Blaire, help yourselves to a Wacan Berry!”

However, when Ember held one up to Vayne, the heroic Arcanine Moemon jumped back slightly with his hands held up. “S-Sorry, but I must pass… I’m actually allergic to these kinds of berries, last time I had one, I was bedridden for a week! And as a warrior of justice, I cannot afford to get sick!”

Ali snickered slightly when she saw the ‘hero’ of a Moemon show fear for a tiny little berry… Albeit, the berry had a weird smell to it, like it was incense or something like that…

What could the harm in one little bite be?
121121211121.title: Lunch Special!

choices: Before Fontina can look, a familiar girl Mightyena sneaks into the library
*growl* Fontina: "Skipping breakfast is never good..."
As Fontina looks for the book, she finds an older book, covered in dust
Dealer's Choice
Dealer's Chocie
13.content:
It was a cool, crisp morning at Gijinka Academy, the sun was barely even rising over the island designed academy. Most of the students were still sleeping in the dorms that sat parallel to each other, however there were a few students who were up at this hour (like the energized Jolteon Moemon that was running laps around the school grounds). The main building itself was as dark as the night, save for a few lights that were on and showed that there was activity going on in the building.

One light belonged to the library, where only one figure was inside, with a large amount of books surrounding her.

“Oh literature… You truly are the best way to wake up in the morning.”

The library itself was quite impressive, with two floors of shelves that contained a near unlimited number of books that lined the walls and stand up shelves. Famous works, student papers, and even a section of manga (courtesy of a familiar Dragonair Principal) – whatever your taste in genre and need of references, you could find it here.

At the front desk, there were several large piles of books atop of the desk. And seated behind the piles of books was the rumored ‘Blue Rose of the Library’ – one Vaporeon Moemon known as Fontina with a book in her hands. She was a young blossoming woman, with short blue hair that was pulled from her beautiful, glasses-wearing face. She was dressed in a white blouse with a long blue skirt that went down to her ankles, and her clothes hugged onto her ample curves, showing off her hourglass figure in the works.

As she read the book, Fontina sighed to herself, her mind placing her in the place of the main heroine in the story… Being swept up into the arms a handsome, and rugged Lucario Moemon with a muscular body dressed in thin blue clothing that exposed a lot of muscular, tanned skin with his long black hair billowing in the wind.

Fontina’s heart began to beat faster and faster as her mind began to picture her face growing closer and closer towards the Lucario moemon’s face, their mouths only inches away from each other…

She could almost feel his warm breath caressing her lips…

“Good morning Ms. Fontina.”

Fontia snapped out of her fantasy, throwing the book in her hands up into the air, “GARGH!”

“… Daydreaming again?”

Fontina’s face was a bright crimson as she realized that standing in front of the desk was a relatively handsome older man, dressed in a bright red leisure suit. He had tanned skin and bright, golden blonde hair that was tied back into nine long pony tails that he had a few draped over his shoulders while others were left to hang freely behind his back. The man raised an eyebrow behind his red tinted glasses at the sight of the younger woman’s flushed face. “Sorry for scaring you Ms. Fontina…”

“N-Not a problem, Mr. Sunny!” Fontina yelped as she bowed slightly towards the Ninetails Moemon that stood before her. “I… I just got caught up in the… Heat of the moment.”

“We all have those moments, Ms. Fontina,” Mr. Sunny chuckled as he held up a book. “Besides, I’ve known you for about three years now Ms. Fontina, as your Vice Principal, I know what makes you tick.”

Indeed, Mr. Sunny was the current Vice Principal of this fine Gijinka Academy, he was set to become the principal this year… But…

“Uh, r-right,” Fontina muttered as she rubbed the back of her head. “So, c-can I help you today Mr. Sunny?”

“Nah, just hoping to get some quiet time before I have to deal with the new headache of a principal,” Mr. Sunny growled loudly as he crossed his arms. “He’s got a lot of problems to him and he seems to be underestimating the job. And frankly… With freshman orientation going on today… Gagh. I picked a good time to give up cigarettes.”

“Well, sir,” Fontina chuckled nervously. “We can only hope that he’ll be good…”

“Yeah, fat chance,” Mr. Sunny sighed loudly. “In any case, thanks for taking the librarian position… I guess it beats hanging around the dorms during the first two class periods.”

“I enjoy this work,” Fontina answered back, smiling at the books around her.

“Well, keep up the good work then,” Mr. Sunny replied as he began to walk away.

Fontina sighed in relief, Mr. Sunny was normally a nice person, but ever since he learned that the principal position was given to a ‘Don Tanner’, he seemed to be a bit more on edge recently.

‘Where’d the book go?’ Fontina questioned as she looked around, trying to find the book she had just thrown.
13.title: Fontina - The Curvy Librarian

choices: Blaire walks out with some of these new ingredients...
Blaire actually lets Fontina in the back and pick what she wants!
Apparantly the other Eon siblings had the same idea as Fontina(family breakfast)
132.content:
The crowning corsage of the library searched amongst her small hillock of literature. She scattered tomes delicately if not just a little haphazardly, "Ohh..." Fontina moaned as she bit the curvature of her index finger, "Where is it?" she whined, not finding her somewhat lusty tome of literature anywhere in sight.

Well, she was pretty startled when Mr. Sunny interrupted her. And, quite familiar with her own habits and excitable nature, it wasn't a stretch that the feeling of launching out of her own skin was actually just her book flying out of her hands and landing somewhere in the library. Realizing this, Fontina soon grew red with embarrassment and started looking in the other aisles. "I hope I didn't hit anybody..." she said quietly to herself as she searched the rows in front of her. Finally finding it, three rows down the line, Fontina just smiled and let bygones be bygones, quickly thumbing open the book back to her previous page.

As she skimmed through the words, Fontina found it noticeably harder than before to get as lost in the literature. The elements were all there; a quiet library, the musty perfume of time-worn pages, the lusty yet swashbuckling adventures of Pirate Captain Raymundo the Lucario moemon nestled firmly within her grasp. Yes, it seemed like the perfect way to start anybody's first day of senior year, but...

The loud grumbling noises emanating from her stomach were far from soothing and did little to contribute to the overall mood.

Fontina grumbled as she looked down at her waist, rather what she could see past her blossoming breasts. Puberty had hit her like a ton of bricks, it seemed, and felt it necessary to "bless" her with breasts the size of melons. Not only were they cumbersome, but it was kind of hard to get close to anybody... both emotionally and physically. They, along with her full hips and supple rear, were just the unwanted gift of growing up. There were plenty of days Fontina wished that she could just go back to being that cute little Eevee moemon. But those days had their downsides too, namely one that she was still trying to rid herself of: baby fat. Even at her age, Fontina still had a small layer of chub present from her childhood days of yore. It wasn't all too bad... but it did get to her at times. Namely now, when the pudge demanded to be fed.

She let out a low whine as she touched her relatively flat stomach; "Skipping breakfast is never good..." she grumbled, resigning quite easily to the whims of her appetite

Checking her watch, 6:45, and deeming it plenty of time before class started and she would be required to stay in the library, Fontina decided that a little pre-duty breakfast would do her some good. She grabbed an armful of books and walked out of the spacious library. Even more exciting still, this would be the first time since last year that she got to see...

***


"Fontina!"

Behind the serving counter of the school's cafeteria, there was a large staff of various breeding that tended to the school's menu for breakfast and lunch, usually even whipping up a little something for dinner, considering the large majority of students who couldn't cook. In charge of that whole staff was Blaire, one of the most talented culinary prodigies in Kanto and Fontina's biggest sister. Though once only determined by age, the years of sampling her own cuisine had certainly given a new meaning to the title "biggest sister". In the short years after graduation, Blaire's waistline had expanded from itty-bitty to exponentially wide.

Blaire's short red hair just barely scorched the already golden brown of her forehead, though most of it was hidden by a required hairnet. Her face was innocently cherubic, with a set of matching chins and full, round cheeks that dimpled as when she smiled. Her breasts, humongous being the only words to describe them at this point, hung heavily atop the fleshy foundation that was her draping stomach; said stomach so large that even now, standing a good two feet away from the counter, was deeply cut by the long silver handle of her tray. And while it wasn't visible, Fontina knew her sister. If she had to guess, Blaire was probably wearing some hot-pants right now. She never really did accept that whole "fat girl" fashion very well.

"Hey Blaire!", Fontina greeted her older sister enthusiastically. Her family had always been close, and it really upset her that she wasn't allowed to come home after school ended last year. As such, she felt a sort of hole that needed to be filled with Blaire. Maybe she should invite her back to her dorm once in a while to make up for lost time? "How've you been?"

"Oh, just awesome!" she said excitedly, getting that little wrinkle on the bridge of her nose as she smiled emphatically, "Mr. Sunny signed the school up to deal with some new ingredients from Orre. My crew and I have been working with them all summer!" the massive moemon giggled as she lifted the metal lid off of a piping hot bin of oatmeal. "Oh, really? Is that why you couldn't come home?" Fontina asked, inquisitive nature taking predominance over appetite. "Yeah, Sunny paid us overtime for it, so I guess I don't mind too much." she said nonchalantly, turning apologetic quickly, "But I missed you guys so much! How's Mom? Did you tell her I said hi? Ooh, what about Miyu, she's supposed to be enrolling this year; I'm so excited!"

Fontina laughed, Blaire always did her best to keep up with the family. "She's great, yes I did, and I'm pretty excited myself." the water-type said casually, "Maybe entering school will finally get her off her butt and doing something." they shared an innocent laugh at the absent Leafeon sibling. "So how about some food? I'll bet you're starved!"

"You read my mind, sis."
132.title: Big Sister, Little Sister

choices: One little taste of the blue fruit can't hurt... Right?
Nah, let's try some of the other food...
Reader's choice.
1322.content:
“Actually,” Blaire giggled slightly with a large grin that would put a Gengar’s smirk to shame. “How would ya like to get a sample of best stuff, little sis?”

“H-Huh?” Fontina questioned with a raised eyebrow behind her glasses. “What do you mean?”

With her pride growing as big as herself, Blaire smiled brightly as she crossed her meaty arms over her bountiful chest (or at least tried to do so), “We got a lot of interesting foods being prepared in the back – Breakfast, brunch or lunch, so what do you think about coming back into the kitchen and get a sneak peak or sample of what the food will be like for this year?”

Fontina was about to say that she couldn’t, since it was a rule that students were allowed in the faculty areas unless they themselves were employed (like how Fontina was working in the library as the beautiful, supple sapphire of the books). Then again, knowing that if a member of the faculty (and her BIGGER sister Blaire) invited a student, they were allowed to…

Grrrrrgggggggglllllllleeeeeee….

Fontina’s light face was now peppered with a healthy blush as she ran her hands to her stomach, trying to prevent the relatively flat (if not soft) belly from sending complaints about being empty. However, Blaire’s keen senses had caught the growl and red on her little sister’s face, “Heh, looks like your stomach answered for you! Now, this is a request from your older sister, just come around the counter and I’ll give you a free sample of what we’ve got!”

“A-Alright,” Fontina chuckled sheepishly as she walked towards the opened end of the counter where kitchen staff was allowed to enter and exit the counter in front of the kitchen. Fontina sighed to herself as she slowly began to pass the counter, she knew that she couldn’t say no to Blaire, which was partially some of the reason why her figure was so… Va-Va-Voom!

“Alright! Time for Fontina’s super secret sampler breakfast!” Blaire giggled as she turned from the counter and began to disappear into the kitchen, Fontina closely following.

At least Fontina was able to confirm something – Blaire was wearing a large pair of black hot pants that hugged her massive tush and thighs.

TTTTTTTTT


After giving Fontina a spare hairnet, the large Flareon Moemon led her curvy, younger sister into the kitchen. The inside of the kitchen was nothing short of impressive as the rest of the academy, brush steel as far as the eye could see with several stoves, fridges, ovens, counters, hanging cooking utensils and other things anyone would find in any other kitchen – Albeit this one was about five times larger than a home kitchen, especially in the kitchen back home.

One thing that Fontina noted was that it seemed that she and Blaire were the only two in the kitchen at the moment, “Um, sister, where is everyone else?”

“Oh, probably on break,” Blaire answered as she walked/waddled through the kitchen, trying to make sure her humongous girth or watermelon sized breasts didn’t bump into something. “We just got done cooking a few minutes before you got here, Fontina. We usually let the other guys go out for a few minutes before the breakfast rush comes into play – Although, as head chef here, I have to be here.”

“Doesn’t it get a little much to watch all this food?” Fontina questioned as she looked into a mixing bowl that seemed to have pancake batter in it (along with what appeared to be humongous chocolate chips). “I mean, all by yourself.”

“No worries,” Blaire answered as she turned over her shoulder, smiling bright at her little sister. “I’ve got my number one assistant in here with me! She’s a freshman this year, but she’s helped out over the summer… In fact, maybe you should meet her!”

“Oh, that would be nice,” Fontina replied with a warm smile, at least there was one person helping her sister.
