1443.title: Mmm... Burrito... I mean, another student...

choices: Hit the cafeteria... That stomach's a growling.
Strike up a conversationg with that Vaporeon girl... I think her name's Fontina
14431.content:
A dreary soul trapped in a mind,
A freedom one cannot perceive.
For here we stand, caught in a self made bind,
Trapped in our bodies, until the day we leave.

It was a cool crisp morning at Gijinka Academy’s island, although a good number of the students were currently sleeping away the time until the sun would finally rise over the island. Still, there were a number of people who were awake, trying to burn what little sunlight appeared – one of which was a certain Vaporeon librarian, but there was another in the same location of the library.

A loud sigh echoed through the air followed by the swift sound of a book closing, sending a splash of sound to echo through the nearly empty library. Although it was early, a young Moemon found the peace and quiet of the library a lot more calming and relaxing than her stuffy dorm room with her dorm mate exercising in the early morning.

Still, she needed this time to think before her classes began – a chance to relax and write some poetry in her book. If the previous year was any indication, she’d need all the chances she could take to relieve her stress. ‘… Well Rhodes, you certainly got your quiet location…’

The Moemon in question was a young Absol girl, with long white hair that caressed the shoulders of her grey hooded sweatshirt, save for the lone, long bang of purple hair that was sprouted from the right of her head of silky white hair. There was no doubt that the girl in question was a student of the academy and that she was the one who was more preoccupied with her own hand written literature.

Looking up from her poetry, Rhodes the Absol turned her attention towards front desk of the library, eyeing the curvaceous Vaporeon Moemon that was seated at the front desk. It wasn’t because Rhodes was attracted to the blue haired, glasses wearing girl (if anything, Rhodes was still in that one phase where she was still trying to figure out whether she played for the same team or not) but rather, the normally red eyed Moemon had green eyes of envy of the water moemon’s curves.

Rhodes subconsciously placed her hands on her stomach, flinching as she managed to grab onto a good portion of flab that her hoodie had hidden – not that there was much mind you, but Rhodes had a paunchy body that she gained over the summer, chunky thighs, a pot belly and a little extra padding around her face. She couldn’t believe that the librarian was actually stressed out about her curves, some people just got the good parts enhanced while Rhodes was left with her bottom heavy frame.

Still, as long as Rhodes had her poetry, she could get past her envy… She’d only write about it instead.

But writing poetry and pushing down secret envy did pass the time, the time before classes truly was boredom incarnate, and even doing something that you love can’t cure that curse. Heck, maybe she would get some breakfast, the cafeteria food was pretty good last year…

Then again, it was because of that food that gave Rhodes her paunchy figure in the first place.

Maybe Rhodes should try to find someone else to talk to, maybe even that busty Vaporeon librarian girl? But what the heck would they talk about?

Rhodes sighed again, as she looked at the small notebook she had on the desk before her, knowing that she had just finished writing on the final page of her notebook. For over the summer, she had spent countless hours writing in that little black booklet and now that it was full, it was time for a new one.

Still, that did give her an excuse to do something else with her morning…

She just didn’t know what. Heck, her roommate was probably burning away whatever little calories she had eaten the previous night – That girl practically had a metabolism that was electrified.

“So…” Rhodes muttered under her breath. “What the hell should I do?”
14431.title: The Audio-challenged Absol - Rhodes

choices: Which actually turns out to be a lot of food... Rhodes is a little off put by it
Which is a small breakfast. However, Rhodes gets some company while she waits...
144311.content:
Going against every instinct that a young girl with low self esteem such as herself felt, grabbing some breakfast couldn't hurt the problem. Just a little mind you, keeping in spirit with her grudge against every part of her anatomy that bulged.

Closing what was probably her eighth composition notebook since enrolling with a sigh, she looked upwards towards the beautifully endowed librarian. How she wished to be like her; large chest, full hips, but still maintain an air of intelligence. But it seemed to be a pipe dream, she would always be Rhodes. And that was a little too much for her to handle.

After putting her notebook back in her messenger bag, the young student quietly rose from her seat and went about her business to the exit.

"O-Oh!" came a voice from behind her, sitting amongst a mountain of books waiting to be shelved, "Come again!"

Rhodes took a glance towards the library's not-so fabled Blue Rose, or so she'd heard her been called by her classmates, and let out a small smile that hid her envy. She nodded her head slightly in affirmation and pushed the door open, putting her in the middle of the first-floor rotunda. Taking a left and heading down one of the many halls, Rhodes knew that eventually she would find herself at the cafeteria...

Placing her hands in the pockets of her hoodie, Rhodes trekked forwards. It wouldn't matter just how much room there was left to fill inside this big bulky ensemble. To her it would still be too little. Looking down, she could see the folds of what were no doubt her belly inflating outwards underneath her jacket. Panicking, she made sure that it was just the fabric of her sweater. A little sigh of relief escaped her thin lips before she went back to brooding.

The light tapping of her trainers' rubber soles against the linoleum floors kept tempo for her thoughts. They were all timed with the rhythmic sounds of her slow steady gait. It wasn't a sexy saunter, she'd never have the courage to parade herself around like some of the girls at this academy, nor a straight-legged stride of confidence, as she simply lacked the essential confidence to pull something like that off. Her steps were quiet and unassuming, as was she.

Her head sank as she fell deeper and deeper into her own thoughts, letting waves of despair hit her over and over again. With her freshman year come and gone, Rhodes was certain that the year could have only gotten better. However in the three months living at home in lethargic practice, the non-athletic Absol moemon had neglected doing much of anything. As a result, several pounds crept their way underneath her misleadingly athletic attire; said pounds attaching taking it upon themselves to swell her once rather slender figure outwards slightly.

She was rather excited about having Gym this year, until she realized that she would have to parade her paunch about like the freak show that she felt.

Letting out a small whimper to voice her discontent, Rhodes found that she had most assuredly arrived at the very center of what she was trying to avoid: food.

Even from the outside, Rhode's dainty sniffer picked up on very familiar aromas. Belgium waffles cooked to perfection, french toast sopped in syrup, stacks of pancakes and breakfast sausage in all manners. The thought of such sinfully delicious food sent two reactions through the diet-conscious girl. On one hand, her stomach churned in disgust and anticipation. She was never really one for much self control, and a good majority of her bad habits had been picked up during her freshamn year in this very cafeteria. However she found herself salivating slightly at her return to professionally made breakfast.

Gulping, Rhodes pushed the heavy doors open and walked inside...

***


Like everything else in St. Gijinka's Academy for Bright and Talented Youths, the cafeteria was only the epitome of class.

Aside from the few ranging students who had dirtied up their spaces with surprisingly messy eating habits, the cafetorium was a picture of perfection. Clothed rectangular tables ran in ten long rows that stretched towards the back of the room, leaving a little bit room to the left where the food was prepared and brought out by the help. In the middle, where the eleventh row of tables used to sit, a new tiled tapestry of various legendary moemon of ages past was revealed in an uncoiling fashion as if they were being called to action. The corners of the room were decorated with various plants and gargoyle busts of Sableye. And in the back was where the teachers sat, in their own table that was much wider and turned horizontally so as to set it apart from the others.

Rhodes looked absolutely tiny as she stepped into the large room.

She never really quite remembered it being so large, but considering the renovation budget that forced most students to go home for the Summer, she wasn't really surprised.

Quietly taking her place at an unoccupied table, Rhodes was left to herself for a few minutes before she was greeted by a School Service girl, dressed in a cute pink waitressing garment.

"Good morning valued student!" she said in a too-perky tone, "Can I get you started with something healthy? Breakfast is the most important meal of the day, so why not make it count with one of Mr. Sunny's personal favorites?"

Mr. Sunny had his own menu? That was a laugh. She hadn't been to his office yet, but from what Rhodes had heard the Vice-Principal, a bearded Ninetails moemon, took himself way too seriously. She would have declined, but...

"Um, excuse me..." Rhodes said softly, "But there isn't another option than what Mr. Sunny would reccommend..."

The young moemon giggled, "Yes ma'am, Mr. Sunny and Principal Tanner felt that some students had been taking advantage of the lucrative ordering process in the past, so we here at St. Gijinkas have implemented a one-to-two choice range. Don't worry though, you're still getting your money's worth!"

"Oh..." Rhodes said sadly, "D-Don't you think that kind of defeats the purpose of breakfast? Not letting us eat what we want, I mean..."

"Luckily I don't get paid to think!" the chipper waitress said in a ditzy tone, "Now, your order?"

"Um... I guess I'll have the Sunny Special Number One..."
144311.title: New Year, New Menu... Same Insecurities

choices: Kay orders a really big breakfast! Too big for her! (Rhodes sneaks a few bites)
Uh... Dealer's choice?
1443112.content:
“Um… I guess I’ll have the Sunny Special Number One…” Rhodes muttered as she slumped down into her seat. At the very least, the specials told what the meals consisted of – This one was actually quite small when compared with the rest, and the meal consisted of a stack of pancakes, a bowl of fruit and a beverage of choice. “Just a glass of water will work.”

The ditzy waitress nodded before she walked away, sashaying her hips with each step. Even the waitresses here had a better figure than Rhodes, and slowly her envious thoughts began to slip into her mind once again, ‘I’m willing to bet that the reason they got the menus was to accommodate the ditzy waitresses… Nothing more than eye candy for the masses.’

Even though her thoughts were strong and shot through the quiet moemon’s mind, they were slowly being clouded by the massive aroma that lofted through the air. Warm syrup, sizzling bacon, and grilled vegetables all began to invade Rhodes’ mind and began to make her stomach grumble slightly. How often had the dark-type Moemon hated to hear that sound from her paunch? She had lost count over the summer, each time when she had to keep the beast inside her stomach from becoming noisier.

The thought of dieting had definitely crossed Rhodes’ mind countless times, heck, she’s tried dieting even more times. As she placed her hands on her soft paunch through her hood’s pockets, Rhodes sighed loudly, there was more of her to grab then there was before the summer had come. It wouldn’t have been bad if the weight had gone to the right places, but no, it had to conglomerate all in her middle for the most part.

The Blue Rose of the library, Rhodes’ thoughts returned to that curvy librarian again. The Absol girl closed her eyes and thought back. This morning wasn’t the first time Rhodes saw the blue haired girl, after all, the library was one of Rhodes’ favorite places to write her poetry, so she saw the girl a few times before the summer – and decided to compare some mental pictures.

…

Yeah, it seemed as though not even the Blue Rose was immune to calories – Rhodes recalled that the Vaporeon girl was a little bit smaller, and not just in the T and A department, Rhodes remembered that the Blue Rose wasn’t as soft around the middle before the summer. It wasn’t as bad as Rhodes’, but it was still noticeable if someone had a memory like Rhodes’, but no one would notice thanks to the other ample curves that the Vaporeon girl had.

A loud sigh escaped Rhodes’ lips as she slumped again in her seat, she’d probably be able to stand this paunch of her if she had curves like that Vaporeon girl.

(Too bad she doesn’t know of Fontina’s own problems lol)

Heck, Rhodes would be content to have a slim figure with barely any curves, anything would be better, anything to make sure that she wouldn’t feel so down about her body. No curves seemed better than to have one slope of a curve to her.

‘Maybe I should go on those jogs like my roommate,’ Rhodes thought to herself, trying to fight off the wondrous smells that were invading her nose. ‘At least then I’d might be able to slim down…’

“Hey there Rhodie!”

Rhodes’ eyes snapped open, and she almost jumped from her seat when she realized that she was looking at a large pair of blue eyes that were too close for comfort. “URK!”

Rhodes pulled back her head and grimaced when she saw that the two large blue eyes belonged to a grinning tanned and cute face that was topped off messy, electrified yellow hair. ‘Speak of the devil.’

The grinning face pulled back to reveal that the owner of that face was a slim young girl with bright skin and spiky blonde hair that was combed out of her sharp (yet oddly cute) face. Her slim petite figure was covered with a pair of white shorts and a black tube top that showed her almost curve-less figure. With the electrified smile on her face, it was easy to see that she was a Jolteon Moemon… But she was not just any Jolteon Moemon…

“I thought I asked you not to call me that, Kay,” Rhodes groaned as she felt her soul slowly clamber back into her body after being scared by the Jolteon girl.

“Aw, where’s your sense of fun?” Kay pouted slightly with a fake sad look on her face. Almost immediately, the fake look melted away and her charged up smile reappeared on her face. “Come on, Rhodie’s a good nick name for ya! It’s cute!”

Rhodes sighed again. This Jolteon, this ball of living energy, this girl named Kay – Was her roommate. One of the stronger sources of Rhodes’ insecurities and envy (only being topped by that Vaporeon’s curves) with a body that Kay was able to show off without a second thought. “Please don’t call me that, I have to put up with you waking up at five thirty in the morning to go for your jogs, the least you could do is call me what I want you to call me.”

Kay pouted again, but then changed her expression again as she reached into her white shorts and pulled out a small… Candy bar? Within moments Kay had already opened the wrapper and had sunk her teeth into the bar, “Mu dunth haff m bae tu meef.”*

*(Translation: “You don’t have to be so mean.”)

With a slap to her forehead, Rhodes lowered her head slightly. That was another reason why she wasn’t too much of a fan of her roommate – Kay seemed to be able to eat anything without worrying about adding a single inch to her non-existent waist! Sometimes Rhodes thought that most of her bad eating habits came from Kay herself – She never seemed to gain any weight last year and ate the worst of foods.

And as such, Rhodes only seemed to eat the worst of foods during the summer, and thus, anyone could see what the results were. “What in the world is that?”

Kay gulped and smirked as she held up the wrapper, “Its some sort of energy bar that I got from one of the new vending machines – They’re really tasty!”

It certainly didn’t look like an energy bar, and Rhodes was certain that anything covered with chocolate wasn’t good for you. But Kay finished off the bar and placed the empty wrapper on the table, “And they’re cheap too! Every time I passed one of the vending machines, I couldn’t help but stop and buy another one of these bars!”

Rhodes blinked a few times, “How many did you buy?”

“I lost count after the first ten,” Kay stated nonchalantly as she licked her lips.

Rhodes tilted her head and was dumbstruck. How in the world did this Jolteon girl manage to down more than ten of those bars?! Rhodes would have to check out one of those bars some time, but something was bugging Rhodes. “Wait, then why are you in here?”

“Are you kidding?” Kay questioned as she held up the menu card up. “Why does anyone come here? For breakfast!”

Rhodes blinked a few times in confusion as she looked at Kay. Where was this Jolteon girl putting all of that food?
1443112.title: Sunnyside Special and the Electric Company

choices: Off to class, Rhodie's first period is Gym class, so she'd better be prepared!
Off to class, Rhodie's first period is History though, so nothing too stressful.
14431122.content:
A good question indeed, one that had bothered Rhodes since the beginning of their time together.

Kay seemed to eat constantly, and only for her to maintain the size 0 shorts that she so easily wriggled her way into even today. Her figure, despite all the incessant nibbling on heavy breakfasts, munching on afternoon snacks, or somehow managing to eat ten energy bars and still have room for more, remained chiseled and firm.

Kay's metabolism had yielded all overeating fruitless. She never ate right and she never dieted. All Kay ever seemed to do was jog and practice her battle techniques (though despite her lightning-quick body mechanics, she never really seemed to use anything other than Agility and Quick Attack). Her teeny-weeny belly shirt didn't contain even the teeny-weeniest of bellies; instead sporting a tanned, toned four-pack that was very much the envy of her roommate. Her thick calves were hard like rock, and her rear small yet perky...

It just simply wasn't fair.

As Kay sat down across from her, jabbering on about this that and the other, Rhodes couldn't help but think that she had been dealt a bum deal in life. Here she was, not exactly overeating per say, feeling like a blimp where ever-hungry Kay felt so in place and comfortable with herself! Deep down inside, Rhodes began to fester (as feelings of slighted revenge were quite common for her species) and suddenly it came out-

"You're gonna get really fat if you keep eating like that."

There, she said it. She had completely caught Kay in the middle of her sentence, interrupting her and leaving that chiseled face with a contorted look of confusion. It felt good to get some of that out of her.

Kay snorted, "Believe you me, girl, you're not the first person to tell me that." she continued, undaunted by her roomie's sudden burst of social awkwardity, "Noir and Mama are always getting onto me about that-" here she giggled again, mimicking who was probably her mother- "Kay, if you don't stop stuffing your face, you're gonna blow up! I did not struggle giving birth for eighteen hours just so my baby girl could blow up like a balloon, and your last name is not Lax, so put those ice cream cones down!"

She lost it, chuckling to herself, rather bemused by the throaty rendition of her mother's voice, "But I didn't, so it's totally cool."

Rhodes' slump relaxed a bit, she couldn't help but laugh at Kay's impersonations even if they all did sound the same. "Y-Yeah..." she snickered, "But really I don't see how you do it, Kay." she said calmly, the Feelings dying down a bit now that she had a good laugh with her friend.

"Lightning-quick metabolism!" Kay said with a thumbs up, "Always had one, ever since I was a pupster!"

"That's nice." Rhodes said rather dourly, realizing that there was no way to emulate one's metabolism. Again, it just simply wasn't fair.

A split-second later Rhodes' waitress reappeared with her modest meal in hand, what looked to be a matching set of pancakes with a sliver of butter, some miscellanious berries chopped up in a bowl, and an empty glass in hand. As she exited the kitchen, Rhodes could see that she was glancing around the mostly-empty tables, trying to place her no doubt, when suddenly she spied just who this plate was meant for.

"Sorry for the wait!" the waitress said merrily as she sauntered up to her end of the long table. She placed the meal down in front of her and filled her glass before a cute little curtsey, "Thank you for your service, and if you need anything my name is Millie. Just holler, 'kay?" and with that, she was off...

Silence as Rhodes readys herself for a light breakfast, not noticing Kay's glances towards her plate...

"So that looks really good." Kay said eagerly, "You should totally let me have some of that."

"Have what?" Rhodes asked, eyebrow raised, "Kay you can't have my breakfast."

"Well, not the fruit." she said laxly, removing the bowl from the plate, "Or the water, I'm more of an OJ person myself."

Kay's slender fingers grabbed at the edges of Rhodes' plate, trying to pull it within her grasp. Rhodes of course fought back, pulling back at it. "Kay, knock it off!" she growled, "I already said you can't have it!"

"You can keep the fruit and the water!"

"Ugh, fine!" Rhodes huffed, "Just take it, ya fatty."

Kay smiled, "Thank you", before sliding the bowl of fruit back over to Rhodes. Nimbly, she sliced into the flaky golden griddlecake, only stopping to reach for a packet of syrup and drenching the poor thing before continuing. Her gusto made apparent, she attempted to continue her conversation with Rhodes, despite her full mouth- much to the latter's disgust.

Nasty thoughts filled her pretty little head about Kay. Again, it was just natural to her species to hold contempt. She found herself thinking horrible thoughts, feeling guilty for it of course, but not enough to really stop.

She could picture Kay, an ideal Kay for the moment, sitting across from her. No doubt if she kept eating like this, that pretty diamond-shaped face would bubble outwards, a second chin hanging heavily between her chubby cheeks. Wide arms that would jiggle every time she lifted something to her greedy mouth, but breasts to big that they impeded her feast. She would have to struggle over her own bulk to feed herself, already having to sit a whole foot away from the table because of her massive stomach that cut so painfully into its surface. And her chair? More like chairs as they struggled to keep whatever massive rear end that this ideal Kay would sport.

No. No more jogging for Kay, no more early mornings, but plenty of eating whatever she wanted...

But alas, that was all just fantasy. Kay would never gain weight, or at least that's how it seemed. But that didn't mean Rhodes had to be that "fat one" out of the two of them, did it? It just didn't seem fair to think that Kay, who ate literally everything that came to her mind remain so slender while she only indulged modestly and felt so... so... so fat!

And with that last thought, the bell rang. Apparently they had both gotten here just a little too late to enjoy a full meal.

"Great..." Rhodes spat unto herself as she looked woefully at her lack of a breakfast...
14431122.title: to Feel Fat Like Me

choices: Rhodes manages to finish the laps, but is exhausted
Rhodes accidentally trips and injures herself!
144311221.content:
“Great…” Rhodes spat unto herself as she looked woefully at her lack of a breakfast… And sighed under her breath when she remembered what her first class of this semester was, and it was the worst class that she could possibly have…

Physical Education, or A.K.A. Gym.

So far this morning was taxing on Rhodes’ mental state, might as well go the extra mile and add a physical beating to her as well. Although, before she left, Rhodes couldn’t help but notice that despite the fact that the bell had rung, Kay was still just sitting at the table, stuffing her thin (fat) face as if she hadn’t heard the bell at all. And while Rhodes wanted nothing more than to see that skinny little Jolteon of energy blow up like a Driftblim, she didn’t want to see her roommate be late to class.

Well, maybe…

“Should you really be stuffing your face?” Rhodes asked as she stood up from the table, grabbing a few pieces of fruit from the bowl (Might as well get something in her stomach before dealing with the Cobalt Coach of the Academy). “Class is going to begin in a few minutes.”

“Naw, don’t worry Rhodie,” Kay replied as she lifted up a forkful griddlecake, with syrup dripping from the buttery breakfast food. Before Kay spoke again, she shoved the fork into her mouth and began to chew/talk. “Mah’ll doff fis, un piff to dass!”

(Translation: “I’ll down this, and zip to class!”)

With one last look at her skinny roommate’s slim figure (save for the small bulge where her four pack was (which was more than likely from the fact of being stuffed with who knows how many energy bars and this breakfast that she was already downing) which caught Rhodes’ eyes quite easily), Rhodes popped a few berries into her mouth and began to walk away.

“Later Rhodie! Don’t work too much!”

Rhodes sighed under her breath when she heard Kay call out to her, and slowly raised her hand up to wave back to her.

-----------


While gym class was rather arduous (thanks to the Cobalt Coach’s idea that every student should have the ideal body), it was the dreaded locker room that really took its toll on Rhodes’ mind. All around her were a number of other moemon girls, each of them stripping from their clothes and revealing their flesh. Kay and the blooming rose of the library main have been a good source of Rhodes’ insecurities…

It seemed that almost every other girl in the locker room had a better body than Rhodes, tight behinds, toned stomachs and overall sleekness made Rhodes look down at her own body in disgust. She had already removed her hoodie and undershirt to see the damage of what the summer had done to her – the two breasts that she had concealed in a simple black bra were starting to overflow the modest cups, with the straps cutting into her flesh each and every time she took a breath. But, as she looked past her slightly grown bust, Rhodes’ eyes landed on the one thing that seemed to plague her no matter what…

That pale dome of flesh that was her belly, that drooping example of moemon gluttony that rose like dough again when she took a breath. She could feel the roles of flab oozing off her and jiggling with every movement she took to change into her gym clothes… Speaking of, Rhodes wrapped her fingers around the waist of her sweatpants, a little wary about pulling down the last shield of hers to block people from viewing her chunky body.

But since she didn’t want to get yelled at by the Cobalt Coach, Rhodes slowly wrung her hands around the fabric and began to pull them down past her bulbous behind and chunky thunder-thighs-in-the-making, feeling the tight matching black panties she wore today clung tighter to her pudgy posterior. Rhodes couldn’t bear to imagine what damage that took from her binging over the summer.

And here came the other portion of the locker room experience that Rhodes despised – Putting on the gym clothes. First came the short sleeved black shirt that Rhodes had chosen for her gym clothes, they were from her gym class before the summer began and she had neglected to purchase bigger workout clothes (it wasn’t on the top of her list of things to buy). But with that gnawing on the back of her mind, Rhodes slowly slipped the black fabric over her head and as she slipped her arms through the sleeves, she could feel the tight sleeves get stuffed with her arm fat, and even feel the sleeves sink into her skin. With a grimace on her face, Rhodes began to pull down the rest of the shirt, feeling how tight the fabric was as it clung to her breasts and stomach like a second skin.

Then came the shorts, sweatpants were only allowed in gym during the winter months, so Rhodes was stuck with a small pair of black workout shorts, which like the shirt were from last semester, before her gain over the summer months.

Needless to say, Rhodes wasn’t looking forward to wearing the shorts…

-------


“Come on! Move it, move it, move it!”

Inside the large gym, the students were all jogging around the expansive room with the gym teacher jogging in front of the pack, running backwards to keep an eye on his students as they jogged behind him. The gym teacher – the Cobalt Coach – was accurately named for he wore a deep blue tracksuit that hugged his highly muscular frame and had a few yellow streaks at the shoulders. The Cobalt Coach had a rugged face with the beginnings of a stubble on his face and had short dark blue hair that was glistening with sweat.

This was Coach Athos, a Cobalion, a man who was concerned for not only his own health, but the health of his students. People believed that he was nothing more than a man trying to push people in fulfilling his athletic dreams. “After the summer, you all got lazy! So we gotta kick that life back into you! And the best way to do that is by running! Keep it up! One more lap ladies!”

Despite that, a majority of the class was men and prompted them to run faster, the ladies in the class moaned loudly – They’ve already done ten laps around the large gym!

But, our attention was drawn to the back of the group of jogging students, with Rhodes a few feet behind the rest of the students – going back and forth from trying to adjust the shorts that kept riding up her posterior every few steps she took and pulling down the shirt that kept revealing her pudgy stomach. ‘I… Can’t… Do… This…’

“C’mon Miss Rhodes! Get yer head in the game!”

Rhodes jumped when she realized that Athos was behind her suddenly, yelling at her to keep going faster and faster. ‘How did he get behind me?!’

“Do your best!” Athos roared loudly as he proceeded to jog past the Absol moemon. “Come on! You can do better than this! Moveitmoveitmoveit!”

Rhodes groaned loudly as she pushed herself even more, feeling her clothes riding up on her chubby body, she could feel her body getting heavier and more sluggish, despite the fact that she was speeding up…
144311221.title: Hitting the Gym

choices: Follow the sporty Munchlax Moemon - Lexi, weighing her options
Yet more profiles to read? It never ends!
14433.content:
Don Tanner idly sucked on the straw of his newly obtained soda as he turned his attention to yet another student profile.

Student No. 11

Name: Alexis "Lexi"
Gender: Female
Moemon: Munchlax
Age: 16
Class: Junior
Description: A (currently) short, curvy and athletic girl with shaggy teal hair, big dark eyes, a round face and creamy skin. Her most frequently worn outfit consists of the academy skirt and blazer combo, perfectly following the standard uniform save for being a size too small.
Personality: Energetic and outgoing by choice, she shuns the more academic and sedentary side of things. Instead she pursues sports and other physical activities, with a drive to prove herself as an athletic force to be reckoned with despite her youth, gender and her own biology.
Extra: From a long line of truly immense women, her active lifestyle is as a way of keeping her weight under control along with obsessive calorie counting. Despite her continued efforts, a recent series of growth spurts have been making it more and more difficult to keep in shape - For every inch added to her height, twice as many seem to go elsewhere. While she appreciates the added height, especially since it helps distribute the pounds a little more evenly, the growth spurts also bring more and more intensity to her already immense appetite and her greatest fear is it spiraling out of control and turning her into a mindless eating machine.

"Huh. I wish her luck but..." The Dragonair Principal mused to himself, jotting down a small note. "Better make sure there's plenty of up-sized uniforms around and keep the cafeteria well stocked, just in case. Can't have other students going hungry."
14433.title: Still more?! Better get a soda with that burrito!

choices: To the Track and Fields! The lack of distraction will help her focus - Maybe.
To the Marketplace! The less she lets her appetite build up, the better.
144331.content:
"Wait, that's not right. Some idiot must have just copied the profile and forgot to replace this part." Don frowned at the profile, crossing out 'Junior' under class and scribbling in 'Freshman' next to it. "Shame you can't just edit a page after the fact, but it'll have to do."

-

"WAKE UP! WAKE UP! WAKE UP!" The digitally shrill voice rang out loudly from a small bedside table, accompanied by the not quite as loud rumble of plastic vibrating against the wood with a buzzing rattle. A pale arm snapped out from under the covers, slender fingers snatching the cellphone from it's place and pulling it back into the depths. The alarm was silenced a moment later, shortly followed by a cascade of pillows and blankets tumbling to the bottom of the bed.

Simple gray phone clutched in one hand, tugging the charging cable loose and discarding it, the newly awakened Alexis stretched her arms over her head with a yawn. The action thrust the teal-haired girl's chest out, straining the buttons of her pajama shirt and revealing patches of pale flesh between the gaps. Swinging her legs over the side of the bed, she sluggishly pushed herself to her feet as she rubbed the remnants of sleep out of her eyes.

She had been waking up at five in the morning for her routine for awhile now, but she always woke up with the strong desire to roll over and go back to sleep. It actually didn't matter how long she slept or not, the urge to sleep longer coming from deep down in her somewhere. Glancing blearily at the phone in her hand to confirm the time, she gave another yawn and not for the first time regretted the necessity of such an obnoxious alarm just to get up on time in the morning.

Padding over to the bathroom, an unintentional sway to her hips, she pulled lightly at the waistband of her just a tad too snug pajama pants in a vain effort to get a little more give around her rump. Pausing only to flick on a light, she stepped on a scale tucked in the corner first thing. Stifling another yawn, she glanced down only to blink as her chest and proximity to the wall impeded any chance of glancing at the scale's reading without messing it up in the process.

Grumbling lightly to herself at the hassle, she stepped off the scale and scooted it away from the wall with her foot before trying again. Feelings of apprehension started to kick in, warding off her drowsiness as she pushed her chest down as best she could to get a clear view of the verdict. The frown that tugged her lips downwards made it pretty clear that she wasn't happy with it, stepping off the scale and somewhat roughly kicking it back into the corner.

At a short height of five feet and two inches, a weight of a hundred and fifty-nine pounds was a lot higher than she was comfortable with. Lifting her shirt up the voluptuous moemon revealed a fairly flat stomach, her abs only visible on the edges where a small layer of soft pudge hadn't obscured them. Pressing a hand against her tummy was met with only the briefest amount of squish before coming to the hard resistance of muscle, eliciting a sigh of relief.

Turning her examination to her lower body was met with a lot more squish than her stomach, but the hard layer of muscle underneath was just as firm as it ever was. Casting a glance towards the mirror, she didn't bother examining her chest in any detail. Until these growth spurts of hers stopped, she'd resigned herself to the fact that her already troublesome chest was going to get bigger.

"Muscle has weight, you're not too heavy. Muscle takes up space too, you're not as big as you look." Lexi stated with a firm tone to herself, an often repeated mantra as she tried to be objective about her observations. While both statements were certainly true, the reassurance she felt from them seemed just a tad less every time she said them. Tomorrow her scale might read a hundred and sixty, and she wasn't sure she could handle such a... round-seeming number as that, even if that extra pound might be muscle and not fat.

Reassured enough all the same for the meantime, the teal-haired girl set about tidying herself up for her morning workout. Hair pulled back into a loose ponytail, pajamas replaced with an equally snug sports bra and pants that hugged every curve of her lower body, she slipped on her running sneakers and was out the door into the chilly morning air. Bouncing lightly from foot to foot as she glanced about the area outside her dorm, her body jiggling in it's softer places as a result, she considered her options for her morning run.

She hadn't had as much time to plan a route as she would have liked before her first day of attendance, which would mostly be taken up by orientation and other wastes of time like that. Even so, she hardly wanted to miss or be late to anything as a result of getting lost, no matter how little she actually cared about it. She knew there was a track, as well as other fields, around the main building as well as the general direction. On the other hand, a jog around the marketplace could help get her familiar with the area and provide an opportunity to grab breakfast on the go and save some time before orientation started.

Her stomach gave a rumble at the thought of breakfast, bringing a frown to her face. She knew enough about how the body worked to know that skipping breakfast would be counter productive to her weight management efforts, but at the same time she was always concerned about giving in to any demand her incessant appetite made. Not that refusing really helped, as it just made it worse when she finally did cave.

Lexi considered her options again in light of that. She could A, head out into the fields and track where there was surely no food in sight, only grabbing something to eat once she had finished her workout and gotten ready for orientation, with the hopes of being strong enough to not pig out at the first opportunity. Or B, she could risk the marketplace, trying to placate her hunger with something light and healthy that wouldn't impede her exercises, and hope she didn't just end up snacking the entire time.
144331.title: Lexi - The Weight-Conscious Athlete

choices: A post-run snack, or perhaps full on breakfast, to discuss options over.
A particular sport, be it football, battling, or whatever else.
1443311.content:
Her stomach let out another hungry rumble, the Munchlax Moemon steeling her resolve as she began to jog off towards the track and fields. If anybody else was out and about as early as she was, she didn't see them on her way there. Not that she took the time to really look around, rigidly locking her gaze forward to her destination. Falling into a rhythm, chest and backside bouncing in their constrained garments, the cool and peaceful air about the island helped to ease the weight-conscious girl's concerns.

The light jog to the track was enough to get her blood pumping, bring a feeling of energy to her body and banishing the sluggish lethargy that she always woke up with. Prying her phone from her pants pocket, keeping her momentum going by jogging in place as she did, the teal-haired girl pursed her lips in thought as she math'd out what to set her alarm for. At a slow jog it was half an hour from her dorm to the track, so it'd probably take a bit under an hour to get back to her room to shower and get dressed. Getting breakfast afterwards could take anywhere from an easy ten minutes to another half hour, depending on if she could find something suitable to eat and didn't get lost or stuck in any lines or anything like that. With orientation starting at eight, and accounting for the time to get to the main building...

Lexi gave a small nod to herself as she set the timer for an hour, stuffing her phone back in her pocket where the tight fabric clearly outlined it against the side of her thigh. Taking a few slow, deep breaths as she bounced from one foot to the other, ignoring the twinge of discomfort form her sports bra as she threw herself forward into a run. Feet pounding on the well-packed dirt of the track, the girl slipped into a mechanical trance - Focused only on running, keeping her breathing even, and the track ahead of her. So it was a great shock to her when she suddenly became aware of bright blue eyes and neon yellow hair right in front of her.

On reflex she jerked back, messing up her footing mid-step and sending her stumbling. Flailing her arms to try and keep her balance, nearly bent half over as her feet fumbled beneath her. The effort was futile though, and feeling herself going down she composed herself enough to twist her body around and land heavily on her backside instead of her face.

"Oooh, nice save." A cheery voice complimented, the voluptuous girl shaking off the mildly dazed feeling and turning her gaze towards the source. A lean girl, with pale but lightly tanned skin. The blue eyes and yellow hair immediately clicked in place as the reason for her tumble down onto the dirt. Clad in white shorts and a black tube top, the girl was the definition of a stick. An athletic stick, with nicely chiseled muscle definition across her flat stomach and slender legs, that Lexi realized had been keeping pace with her while jogging backwards of all things.

"What'd..." Lexi paused to catch her breath, a sheen of sweat on her pale skin and the tingle in her legs telling her she'd been at it for awhile before this strange girl surprised her. "What'd you do that for?" She spat out with a scowl, but the girl seemed completely unconcerned as she just laughed and smiled down at her. It struck her that this might be some form of freshman bullying about to take place, that kind of thing being far too common.

"I tried calling out to ya, but you didn't hear me I guess. You were really in the zone there." The girl shrugged, offering a hand to help her to her feet. The Munchlax Moemon hesitated for a moment, having to admit to her own obliviousness at the time, shaking her head to dismiss the offer and pushing herself to her feet. The girl probably didn't mean anything by it, but if she ever needed help getting on her feet then she'd utterly failed to keep her weight under control. The girl just raised her hand up some instead, offering a handshake as she introduced herself. "Names Kay. Don't think I've seen ya before."

"Lexi, this is my first year." Lexi took the offered hand that time, giving a brief but firm shake before turning her attention to dusting the dirt off of her mildly sore backside. Pulling her phone out of her pocket to check that she hadn't damaged it in her sudden fall, she was pleasantly surprised to find her timer only had ten minutes left on it. She'd managed to get through most of her run, so she didn't have to worry about her schedule being completely thrown out of whack.

"Thought so!" Kay gave a self-satisfied grin, before bending over and poking a slender finger right into Lexi's tiny amount of belly flab until meeting the hard resistance of the abs partially obscured underneath. The Munchlax Moemon froze up, bewildered at the sudden violation of personal space. If Kay noticed, she clearly didn't care as she continued speaking with her finger where it was. "My first guess was one of the bookworms trying to lose some summer weight, but then I noticed you were way too good at keeping your form and pace even for some nerd and up close it's pretty obvious you've got a lot of muscle."

Processing all that, the teal haired girl's expression shifted from offense at the weight comment and poke to her stomach to flattered at the compliment on her athletic ability and musculature. Beaming proudly as Kay finally pulled her finger away and straightened up, Lexi took a moment to try and make a guess about Kay in turn. She was obviously very athletic, talked about students returning for the summer... But the Jolteon girl didn't strike her as being much older than her, either. With some slight hesitation she finalized her guesses by verbalizing them. "You're... a sophomore, and in a track club?"

Kay tilted her head to the side in what Lexi could only assume was some kind of amused surprise given the grin still on her face, putting her hands on her slender hips and striking a confident pose. "That's right! Star Runner of the entire school and only in my second year! I'm aiming to break the old records to pieces this year, and the year after that and after that!"

Lexi stared at the... Frankly admirable amount of confidence and ambition on display. It didn't hurt that the sophomore had the sort of purely athletic figure she wished she could have. At least, as Kay had said, a lot of her bulk was muscle. She might not be slender, but she was certainly fit. That was enough for her to feel good about herself. A thought struck her then, that this energetic if slightly strange Jolteon Girl would be an excellent friend and role model to have around and help keep her active and motivated. Someone as sleek as her had to be a good influence on her quest to manage her weight, right?

With a slight start as she realized she'd spaced off for a second there, lost in her own thoughts. "That's amazing." She replied with earnest awe, not bothering to hide any of the admiration she felt. The widening of her grin on her narrow face made it pretty clear to Lexi that Kay didn't mind basking in praise in the least, adding another thought to try and cement their potential friendship. "I'm not especially fast," She admitted honestly, the small nod from the Jolteon showing that she agreed with that assessment. "But I want to bust records into dust and be a star athlete too! I just need to figure out what sport to aim for..."

As Lexi trailed off, Kay just peered intently at her. Then, quick as a wink, the yellow-haired speed demon was all over her personal space again. Rapidly poking at her, the action tickling her in some more sensitive spots and provoking an involuntary laugh. In the brief moment it took the teal-haired girl to reflexively back away, the blonde had already finished observing whatever it was she was observing.

"My professional opinion is..." Kay trailed off for dramatic effect, Lexi perking up as the sense of anticipation welled up within her. She tried to predict what the girl was going to suggest, but she'd already puzzled the choices to death on her own and gotten nowhere with it. Seeming to decide she'd delayed long enough after a few moments, Kay loudly and firmly declared...
1443311.title: Running From Distractions And Into A Distraction

info.brief_description: Welcome to Moemon Academy, where the girls are cute and beginning to 'grow'
info.description:
A single spotlight erupts on a fancy stage, allowing a sleek, yet handsome young man dressed in a blue button up shirt, white T-Shirt and white pants to stroll onto the stage. His long white hair was covered with what appeared to be a fancy baseball cap that had a wing symbol on both sides. As the young man reached the spotlight, he coughed loudly, “Ahem… Greetings YA’LL!

“For those of you who don’t know me, I am the devilishly handsome Don Tanner! I first made my appearance in Moemon Weight Gain Story in the popular Mansion storyline. If you want, I suggest you go to that and add some chapters, the author would really like that… Here’s a link.”

http://www.writing.com/main/interact/item_id/1711753-Moemon-Weight-Gain-Story

Don Tanner smirked again as he lifted his hands up, “But, enough about the past! Welcome to this new story! Moemon… Set in a School setting! Now, before we can begin, a few ground rules…”

1) Only female weight gain/expansion, that isn’t to say that there won’t be male characters in the story, but keep the growing to the girls.
2) Unless you're offering a different choice, please make the posts at least a paragraph long and literate.
3) At the beginning, there will be three original students for you to follow, but there will be more students for you to follow, and you can make your own as well, but, they must go through a style of expansion.
4) Unless magic is involved, please don't make the gainning too overboard (Like no, OMG I gained 500 pounds in ten minutes!).
5) Other forms of expansion (inflation, fruit expansion, water inflation, etc.) are allowed, and in an academy with curses, evil professors and the such, that can be expected to happen
6) Have fun. And for good posts, I will offer a good number of Gift Points!

Don Tanner smirked as he pointed towards the link down below, “Now, how about you click on that and get this story rolling?”
